GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTM DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category for the [procedure/assessment agent]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the procedure agent category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory for the [procedure/assessment agent]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the procedure agent subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the AGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: [Were/Was] there any [procedure/assessment agent(s)] taken/administered?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject was administered any procedure agents. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether any procedure/assessment agent(s) were administered.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile procedure agent records with AEs and/or MH. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [procedure/assessment agent] [name/term]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record only 1 procedure agent per line. Provide the full trade or proprietary name of the procedure agent; otherwise the generic name may be recorded.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: In most cases, the verbatim drug names or treatment will be coded to a standard dictionary (e.g., WHODrug) after the data have been collected on the CRF. For the collection of verbatim procedure agents, the recommendation is to ask sites to provide the full trade or proprietary name since it is more exact than the generic. The full trade name provides the base generic and the appropriate salt for that particular drug. In addition, for coding purposes it helps with Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) classification system code selection. For example, Tylenol with codeine #1 has a different ATC code than Tylenol with codeine #3.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Verbatim name of procedure/assessment agent administered.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For pre-specified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified and free-text interventions, the value of AGPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific procedure/assessment agent or group of agents is pre-specified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: [Has/Was] the subject (been) administered the [procedure/assessment agent]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the procedure agent was administered, by checking Yes or No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: AGOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a pre-specified procedure agent. AGOCCUR is not used for spontaneously free-text reported procedure agent(s). The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. If the response was not asked or answered, populate the SDTMIG variable AGSTAT with "NOT DONE".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the given procedure/assessment agent or group of agents was administered when information about the occurrence of a specific procedure/assessment agent is solicited.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the individual dose per administration of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose of the [procedure agent] taken per administration (e.g., 200).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used when the dose/amount administered has only numeric entries. If non-numeric entries are possible, use the CDASH field AGDSTXT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dose of procedure/assessment agent (e.g., --TRT ) given at one time represented as a numeric value.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the individual dose of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose of [procedure agent] taken per administration (e.g., 200).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text or ranges. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either SDTMIG AGDOSE (if numeric) or AGDOSTXT (if text).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to AGDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to AGDOSTXT in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dose of procedure/assessment agent administered per instance.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the unit (for the dose of the [procedure/assessment agent])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose unit of the [procedure agent] administered (e.g., mg).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When sponsors collect data for amount of dose administered (i.e., Dose, Total Daily Dose), the unit must be collected as well (if applicable).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit associated with the procedure/assessment agent.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the dose form of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the pharmaceutical dosage form (e.g., TABLET CAPSULE SYRUP) for the [procedure agent] [administered].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Some drugs have multiple forms and this field may be needed to code the drug to an ATC level. However, in general, this level of detail should not be necessary except for procedure agents of interest.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The pharmaceutical dosage form in which the AGTRT is physically presented.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the frequency of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record how often the [procedure agent] was administered (e.g., ONCE).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The frequency of the procedure agent. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., AGDOSE, AGDOSEU, AGDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The number of doses administered during a specific interval.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the route of administration of the [procedure/assessment agent]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the route of administration for the [procedure agent].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This additional information may be important to collect on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture a procedure agent's route of administration, for purposes such as coding, and the procedure agent may have more than 1 route. Some companies may use route in coding procedure agents to be able to choose a precise preferred name and ATC code.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The route of administration of the procedure/assessment agent.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the procedure/assessment agent] start date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date the procedure agent was first administered using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). Procedure agent(s) administered during the study are expected to have a complete start date.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The assumption is that sponsors should either have a start date or will indicate that the procedure agent was started before, during or after the study period. The preferred method is to collect a complete start date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only) for procedure agent started a considerable amount of time prior to the start of study are acceptable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AGSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start date when the procedure/assessment agent was first administered, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [procedure/assessment agent] start time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the [procedure agent] was started.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommend collecting the time a procedure agent was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios supports it. Typically, a start time is not collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time a procedure agent administered or the subject records the start time in a diary. See Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and the SDTMIG for more information.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AGSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time the procedure/assessment agent was started, represented in an ambiguous time format (e.g., h:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [procedure/assessment agent] administered prior to AGSTTPT? Was the procedure/assessment agent given prior to study start?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check if the [procedure agent] was started before the study.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors may collect this information rather than start dates. See Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and the SDTMIG for more information.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as AGSTRF or AGSTRTPT. When populating AGSTRF or AGSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field AGPRIOR is "Y", a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When AGPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTMIG variable AGSTRF should be populated. When AGPRIOR is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables AGSTRTPT and AGSTTPT should be used. Note: AGSTRTPT must be in reference to the time-point anchor described in AGSTTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the procedure/assessment agent was administered prior to [AGSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [procedure/assessment agent] ongoing (as of the [study-specific time point or period])?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [procedure agent] as ongoing if the subject has not stopped taking the procedure agent at [the time point defined by the study]. If the procedure agent is ongoing, the end date should be left blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This box should be checked to indicate that theprocedure agent has not stopped at the time of data collection. It is expected that every recorded procedure agent should have either an end date or be checked as ongoing, but not both. However, in cases where ongoing procedure agents are not permitted, it may not be necessary to include an Ongoing field in the CRF. See Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submission, for more information about collecting relative date/time; see the SDTMIG for information about mapping relative times.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as AGENRF or AGENRTPT. When populating AGENRF, if the value of AGONGO is "Y", the values of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating AGENRTPT, if the value of AGONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When AGONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTMIG variable AGENRF should be populated. When AGONGO is used in conjunction with another time point, the SDTMIG variables AGENRTPT and AGENTPT should be used. Note: AGENRTPT must be in reference to the time-point anchor described in AGENTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the procedure/assessment agent is ongoing when no end date is provided.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [procedure/assessment agent's] end date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date the procedure agent was topped using this format (DD-MM-YYYY). If the subject has not stopped [administering/being administered] the procedure agent leave this field blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The assumption is that sponsors should either have an end date or will indicate that the procedure agent was ongoing at the time of collection or at the end of the study. However, in cases where the end date can be determined from dates collected elsewhere in the CRF it is not necessary to include an end date in the CRF. For example, if all procedure agents are administered only once during a trial, the end date will be the same as the start date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the procedure/assessment agent was stopped/ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g. DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [procedure/assessment agent's] end time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the procedure agent was stopped.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommend collecting the time a procedure agent was ended only when a protocol or data collection scenarios require it or the subject records the end time in a diary. Typically, an end time is not collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time a procedure agent is stopped.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AGENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was started, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the procedure, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process. If PRPRESP is used, and the information about a specific standardized procedure name is being solicited, the data from AGTRT may map directly to the SDTMIG AGDECOD variable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of the topic variable (AGTRT) or the modified topic variable (AGMODIFY), if applicable.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This would generally be the class used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The class for the agent, often obtained from a coding dictionary.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This would generally be the class code used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The assigned dictionary code for the class of agent.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: For single-site studies, this is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. \n EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. \n This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category for the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory for the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the CMCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were/Was any (concomitant) [medication(s)/treatment(s)/therapy(ies)] taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject took any (concomitant) [medications/treatments]. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether any (concomitant) medications/treatments/therapies were taken/given.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medication/treatment records with AEs and/or MH. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Description.TranslatedText: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] (name/term)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record only 1 [medication/treatment/therapy] per line. Provide the full trade or proprietary name of the [medication/treatment/therapy]; otherwise the generic name may be recorded.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: In most cases, the verbatim drug names or treatment will be coded to a standard dictionary (e.g., WHODrug) after data have been collected on the CRF. For the collection of verbatim drug name or treatments, the recommendation is for sites to provide the full trade or proprietary name, which is more exact than the generic. The full trade name provides the base generic and the appropriate salt for that particular drug. In addition, for coding purposes, it helps with ATC selection (e.g., Tylenol with codeine #1 has a different ATC code than Tylenol with codeine #3). This field can be used for either prior or concomitant medication/treatments.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Verbatim medication name or treatments (include only treatments with data collection characteristics similar to medications).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For pre-specified interventions, this is a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified and free-text interventions, the value of CMPRESP should be "Y" for all pre-specified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is pre-specified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject take [prespecified (concomitant) medication/treatment/therapy/dose]?; Has the subject taken [prespecified (concomitant) medication/treatment/therapy/dose]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if [specific medication/treatment] was taken by checking Yes or No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: CMOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a pre-specified medication/treatment. CMOCCUR is not used for spontaneously free-text reported concomitant medication/treatments. The site should be able to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. If the question was not asked or answered, populate the SDTMIG variable CMSTAT with "NOT DONE".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the prespecified medication/treatment/therapy (CMTRT) or the group of medications/treatments/therapies was administered when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention was solicited.

Question.TranslatedText: What were the active ingredients?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Prior to a subject's clinical visit, remind all subjects to bring all medications bottles, packs etc. they are taking with them to their clinical visit. Record all active ingredient(s) off the medication label and separate each ingredient with a comma for the name of drug medication or treatment taken. For example, the medication Dolmen, if manufactured in Spain, the active ingredients should be collected as noted below: Active Ingredient: Acetylsalicylic Acid, Ascorbic acid, codeine phosphate.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be collected in addition to the medication/treatment name. Collecting this provides more detailed information when coding to a medication dictionary like WHODrug Dictionary Enhanced Format C, which codes to the ingredient level for many trade-name medications. For example, depending on the country where it is manufactured, the active ingredients in the medication dolmen may be different: In Spain, acetylsalicylic acid, ascorbic acid, codeine phosphate; in Italy and Czech Republic, tenoxicam; in Estonia and Latvia, dexketoprofen trometamol.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Medication ingredients.

Question.TranslatedText: For what indication was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reason the medication was taken based on clinical investigator's evaluation. If taken to treat a condition, and a diagnosis was made, the indication should be the diagnosis. If taken to treat a condition, and no diagnosis was made, the indication should be the signs and symptoms. If taken as prophylaxis, report as "Prophylaxis for " and include a description of the condition(s).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not the pharmacological/therapeutic classification of an agent (e.g., antibiotic, analgesic), but rather the reason for its administration to the subject. This additional information is collected on the CRF when sponsors want to capture the reason(s) a subject took a medication/treatment. This information could be used as deemed appropriate for coding; analysis (e.g., in the classification of medications); reconciling medications/treatments taken by a subject with provided medical history; and/or AEs/SAEs, as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The condition, disease, symptom, or disorder that the concomitant (non-study) medication/treatment/therapy was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the medication/treatment/therapy was taken or administered).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) for which the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier of the Adverse Event for which this (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent is to establish a link between the medication/treatment and the AE that was reported. CMAENO can be used to identify a relationship between records in CM dataset and records in the AE dataset. See the SDTMIG for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the AE domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the adverse event that is the indication for this medication/treatment/therapy.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the medical history event(s) for which the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier of the medical history event for which this (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent is to establish a link between the medical history condition and the medication/treatment taken for the condition. CMMHNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the CM dataset and records in the MH dataset. See the SDTMIG for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the MH domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the medical history condition that is the indication for this medication/treatment/therapy.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the individual dose (of the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] per administration)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose of (concomitant) [medication/treatment] taken per administration (e.g., 200).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used when the dose/amount taken/administered/consumed has only numeric entries. If non-numeric entries are possible, use the CDASH field CMDSTXT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dose of medication/treatment (e.g., --TRT ) given at one time, represented as a numeric value.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the individual dose of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose of (concomitant) [medication/treatment] taken per administration (e.g., 200).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text, or ranges. The data collected in this text-format field should be separated or mapped to either SDTMIG CMDOSE if numeric or CMDOSTXT if text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to CMDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., "200-400") map to CMDOSTXT in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dose of medication/treatment taken per administration.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the total daily dose of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the total dose of (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] taken daily.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For use when only total daily dose is collected on the CRF. For general medications/treatments, it is not recommended to use Total Daily Dose. Instead, this can be calculated from other fields (e.g., Units, Dose, Frequency).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The total amount of CMTRT taken over a day, using the units in CMDOSU.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the unit (for the dose of concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose unit of the dose of concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] taken (e.g., mg.).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When sponsors collect data for amount of dose taken (i.e., Dose, Total Daily Dose), Unit must be collected as well (if applicable).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit associated with the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy taken (e.g., mg in "2 mg 3 times per day").

Question.TranslatedText: What was the dose form of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the pharmaceutical dosage form (e.g., TABLET CAPSULE, SYRUP) of delivery for the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] taken.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Some drugs have multiple forms; this field may be needed to code the drug to an ATC level. However, in general, this level of detail should not be necessary except for medications/treatments of interest.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The pharmaceutical dosage form in which the CMTRT is physically presented.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the frequency of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record how often the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken (e.g., BID, PRN).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The frequency of the concomitant medication/treatment. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., CMDOSE, CMDOSEU, CMDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically using these data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the route of administration of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the route of administration for the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This additional information may be important to collect on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture a medication's/treatment's route of administration, for purposes such as coding; also, the medication/treatment may have more than 1 route. Some companies may use route in coding medications/treatments, to be able to choose a precise preferred name and ATC code.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The route of administration of the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] start date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date the concomitant [medication/treatment] was first taken using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the subject has been taking the concomitant [medication/treatment] for a considerable amount of time prior to the start of the study, it is acceptable to have an incomplete date. Concomitant [medication/treatment] taken during the study are expected to have a complete start date. Prior concomitant [medication/treatment] that are exclusionary should have both a start and end date.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The assumption is that sponsors should either have a Start Date or will indicate that the medication or therapy was started before, during, or after the study period. The preferred method is to collect a complete Start Date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only) for medications/treatment started a considerable amount of time prior to the start of study are acceptable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start date is when the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was first taken, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] start time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the concomitant [medication/treatment] was started.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommend collecting the time a concomitant medication/treatment was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios supports it. Typically, a start time is not collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time a concomitant medication/treatment administered or the subject records the start time in a diary.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was started, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] given/taken prior to [CMSTTPT]?; Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] given/taken prior to study start?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check if the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] was started before the study.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors may collect this information rather than start dates. See Section 3.7, Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and the SDTMIG for more information.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as CMSTRF or CMSTRTPT. When populating CMSTRF, or CMSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field CMPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When CMPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTM variable CMSTRF should be populated. When CMPRIOR is compared to another time point, the SDTM variables CMSTRTPT and CMSTTPT should be used. Note: CMSTRTPT must refer to the time-point anchor described in CMSTTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was given or taken prior to [CMSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] as ongoing if the subject has not stopped taking the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] at [the timepoint defined by the study]. If the concomitant medication is ongoing, the end date should be left blank

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This box should be checked to indicate that the concomitant medication/treatment has not stopped at the time of data collection. It is expected that every recorded medication/treatment should have either an end date or be checked as ongoing, but not both. However, in cases where ongoing concomitant medications/treatments are not permitted, it may not be necessary to include an Ongoing field in the CRF. See Section 3.7, Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submission, for more information about collecting relative date/time; see the SDTMIG for information about mapping relative times.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable (e.g., CMENRF, CMENRTPT). When populating CMENRF, if the value of CMONGO is "Y", the values of "DURING", "AFTER", or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating CMENRTPT, if the value of CMONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When CMONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable CMENRF should be populated. When CMONGO is used in conjunction with another time point, the SDTM variables CMENRTPT and CMENTPT should be used. Note: CMENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in CMENTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy is ongoing when no end date is provided.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] end date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date the concomitant [medication/treatment] was stopped using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the subject has not stopped taking the concomitant [medication/treatment] leave this field blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The assumption is that sponsors should either have an End Date or will indicate that the medication or therapy was ongoing at the time of collection or at the end of the study. However, in cases where the end date can be determined from dates collected elsewhere in the CRF it is not necessary to include an End Date field on the CRF. For example, if all concomitant medications/treatments are administered only once during a trial, the end date will be the same as the start date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date that the subject ended/stopped taking the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] end time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the concomitant medication/treatment was stopped.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommend collecting the time a concomitant medication or treatment was ended only when a protocol or data collection scenario requires it or the subject records the end time in a diary. Typically, an end time is not collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time a concomitant medication/treatment is stopped.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time when the subject ended/stopped taking the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/ --TRT] was [discontinued/stopped/ended]?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Reason for discontinuation of concomitant medication/treatment

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reason the concomitant medication/treatment was stopped.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although frequently used for prior meds, this can be used for any intervention at any timepoint. \n When the dosing of a treatment is recorded over multiple successive records, this variable is applicable only for the (chronologically) last record for the treatment.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The reason the treatment was discontinued.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the generic drug name in published (e.g., WHODrug, SNOMED, ICD9) or sponsor-defined dictionaries.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of the topic variable, CMTRT, or the modified topic variable (CMMODIFY), if applicable.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This would generally be the class used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The class for the intervention (often obtained from a coding dictionary).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This would generally be the class code used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The assigned dictionary code for the class for the intervention.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC1" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 1 Description". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary text description of the first level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) classification system; indicates the anatomical main group.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM ="MATC1CD" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 1 Code". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary code denoting the first level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the anatomical main group.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC2" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 2 Description". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary text description for the second level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the therapeutic main group.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC2CD" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 2 Code". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary code denoting the second level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the therapeutic main group.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC3" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 3 Description". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary text description of the third level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC3CD" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 3 Code". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary code denoting the third level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC4" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 4 Description". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary text description of the fourth level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the chemical/therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC4CD" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 4 Code". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary code denoting the fourth level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the chemical/therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC5" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 5 Description". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary text description of the fifth level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the chemical substance.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. This is populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPCM dataset as the value of SUPPCM.QVAL where SUPPCM.QNAM="CMATC5CD" and SUPPCM.QLABEL="ATC Level 5 Code". Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dictionary code denoting the fifth level of hierarchy within the ATC classification system; indicates the chemical substance.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. \n EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. \n This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the trial epoch?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: [protocol specific]

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the same information is collected more than once in different periods/parts of a study (e.g., Disposition), EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as the title of the page. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Name of the trial epoch with which this element of the arm is associated.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any[study treatment/dose] taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject took any study medications. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. The ECYN is meant to indicate that the exposure as collected form should be completed or inserted into the case book. ECOCCUR would be used when the actual drug name is pre-printed on the CRF. While these might be equivalent in a single-drug study, there are differences in how they would be used in most trials. Therefore, it does not map into the SDTM variable ECOCCUR; ECOCCUR indicates whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. If actual treatment data is available (ECYN ="Y"), ECOCCUR may be populated based on whether subject was actually administered treatment/medication.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the subject took the study medication/ treatment.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the [study treatment/dose]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the study treatment category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the [study treatment/dose]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the study treatment subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. ECSCAT can only be used if there is an ECCAT and it must be a subcategorization of ECCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the ECCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [study treatment/investigational product] name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of study treatment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: ECTRT is the name of the intervention or treatment known to the subject and/or administrator and it is the SDTM topic variable. It is a required variable in SDTM and must have a value in CDASH or a plan to populate it in the SDTM submission datasets (i.e., collected or populated from other sources). If, in a masked study, treatment is collected and known as tablet A to the subject or administrator, then ECTRT="TABLET A". If, in a masked study, the treatment is not known by a synonym and the data are to be exchanged between sponsors, partners, and/or regulatory agency(s), then assign ECTRT the value of "MASKED".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Name of the intervention or treatment known to the subject and/or administrator.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For pre-specified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified and free-text interventions, the value of ECPRESP should be "Y" for all pre-specified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is pre-specified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: Was [study treatment/dose] administered?; Has the subject taken [study treatment/dose]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject took study treatment. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: ECOCCUR is used to indicate whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. ECOCCUR should not be used to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. Not applicable when ECMOOD is "Scheduled".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the study treatment was administered when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention was solicited.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason that the[study treatment/dose] was (not)taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate why the study treatment was or wasnot taken.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the study treatment was or was not taken may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., SUBJECT MISTAKE, SUBJECT REFUSED) or entered as free text. When --REASOC is used, --OCCUR must also be populated in the SDTM dataset with a value of "Y" or "N".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECREASOC" and SUPPEC.QLABEL ="Reason for Occur Value". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why a scheduled study treatment administration did or did not occur.

Question.TranslatedText: Does this record describe scheduled [study treatment/dose] or performed [study treatment/dose]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if this record has happened or is intended to happen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: "SCHEDULED" is for collected subject-level intended dose records. "PERFORMED" is for collected subject-level actual dose records. "Planned" or "Scheduled" can be pre-printed as the CRF name or section header, as applicable. If collecting both the scheduled and performed dosing in the same horizontal record, the sponsor may choose to append "_SCHEDULED" to the ECDOSE/ECDOSTXT variable name to delineate the scheduled dose from the performed dose. The performed dose would just be collected with ECDOSE/ECDOSTXT and ECDOSU.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. When implemented, ECMOOD must be populated for all records.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Mode or condition of the record specifying whether the intervention (activity) is intended to happen or has happened.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the[study treatment/dose] label identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record treatment label identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens that require greater granularity for treatment identifiers, sponsors may need to use additional variables.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lot number of the[study treatment/dose] used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lot number that appears on the container holding the study treatment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The lot number identifies the manufacturing batch of the study treatment. In open-label studies, the reference number on the study treatment container may represent an actual lot number and should be submitted using ECLOT. This variable may be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets. Do not collect other identification variables in this field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Lot number of the ECTRT product.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the study treatment being taken.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because some study treatments may have a food effect, it is important to know whether the dose was taken after the subject had fasted.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. Would only be populated when ECMOOD="PERFORMED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the dose form of the [study treatment/dose]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose form (e.g., SOLUTION, TABLET, LOTION) or enter the appropriate code from the code list.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This must be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options for the same study treatment.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dosage form in which the ECTRT is physically presented.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (start) date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start date of the study treatment administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Date when constant dosing interval of the study treatment started or single administration occurred. When collecting the date for an individual dose, the word "start" may be omitted from the Question Text and Prompt. When ECMOOD is collected and ECMOOD is "SCHEDULED", use "intended" in the question text and prompt. When ECMOOD is collected and ECMOOD is "PERFORMED", use "actual" in the question text and prompt.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start date of study treatment, intended or actual, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (start) time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start time (as complete as possible) when administration of study treatment started.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommend collecting the time a medication was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. When collecting the time for an individual dose, the word "start" may be omitted from the question text and prompt.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start time of study treatment, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (end) date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the end date of the study treatment administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Date when study treatment period stopped.If start date and end date are not expected to be the same date, the collection of the end date is required. If the study design indicates that the start and end are on the same day, the collection of the end date is not required because it can be assigned to be equal to the start date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end date of study treatment, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (end) time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time, (as complete as possible) when study treatment administration stopped (e.g., for infusions this is the time when the infusion ended).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommend collecting the time a medication was ended when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. For infusions, the end time of the infusion is typically needed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end time of study treatment, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the dose (per administration) (of [study treatment/dose])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose or amount of study treatment that was administered to/taken by the subject in the period recorded; from the start date/time to the end date/time inclusive.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Dose or amount taken for single administration of study treatment or per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from diary data, drug accountability data, protocol). Care should be taken when mapping ECDSTXT. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either ECDOSE if numeric or ECDOSTXT if text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be mapped to either ECDOSE if numeric or ECDOSTXT if text.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dose of study medication taken (per administration).

Question.TranslatedText: What were the units for the dose?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit of dose or amount taken per period recorded (e.g., ng, mg, mg/kg).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Unit of dose or amount taken per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose unit must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from protocol, randomization data). The unit should be pre-printed on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for dose and volume units. In blinded trials, the collected unit may be tablet, capsule, etc., since the actual unit is also blinded.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit for intended dose (per administration) for ECDOSE, ECDOSTOT, or ECDOSTXT.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the frequency of [study treatment/dose] dosing?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the frequency the study treatment was administered for a defined period of time (e.g., BID, QID, TID).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options. When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are pre-printed on the CRF. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., ECDOSE, ECDOSEU, ECDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically using these data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the route of administration (of the [study treatment/dose])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the route of administration (e.g., IV, ORAL, TRANSDERMAL) or enter the appropriate code from the code list.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from protocol) or if there are multiple options.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The route of administration of the study treatment.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the intended dose regimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the regimen for the study medication.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The regimen information (e.g., TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF) may further clarify the dose administration and dose frequency. This may be pre-printed or collected. The sponsor may wish to create a codelist to collect this data consistently.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Text description of the intended schedule or regimen for the Intervention.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the dose adjusted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether there was a change in dosing.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring, as it provides a definitive response regarding any dose changes. It provides verification that the associated field on the CRF (ECADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the dose was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change. When using ECMOOD, this field should not be used.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: When ECADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When ECADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable in SUPPEC.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the dose was adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the dose was adjusted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If there was a change in dosing, record the reason for change.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Captures the reason the dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., adverse event, insufficient response) or entered as free text. May be used for variations from protocol-specified doses, or changes from expected doses. Used only when an adjustment is represented in EX dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
