mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the procedure.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the procedure dose adjusted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if the procedure was adjusted from planned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (PRADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the procedure dose/amount was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: When PRADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When PRADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable as a SUPPQ.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the procedure dose/amount was adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the procedure dose was adjusted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record why the procedure dose was adjusted from planned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Captures the reason the PRTRT dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., adverse event, insufficient response) or entered as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of or explanation for why a procedure dose/amount was adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject complete the full course of the [PRTRT]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if the subject completed the intended regimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Depending on how the PTTRT dose details are collected via the CRF/eCRF, it may be possible to derive those data if the regimen data are collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM= "PRTRTCMP" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Treatment Completed". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication of whether the subject completed the intended regimen.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the procedure interrupted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if the procedure was interrupted.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Provides a definitive response regarding any procedure interruption. The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring when the duration of the interruption is collected. In some situations, if the actual duration of the interruption is not collected, or not derived, this information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the procedure was interrupted.

Question.TranslatedText: Why was the procedure interrupted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reason the procedure was interrupted.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH field is use to collected the reason why an intervention was interrupted. The sponsor may define controlled terminology.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRITRPRS" and SUPPPR.QLABEL ="Reason Intervention Interrupted". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why the intervention was interrupted.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the duration of the procedure interruption?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record how long the procedure was interrupted before it resumed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is used to collect the duration of procedure interruption. In some situations, the duration of the interruption may not be collected but calculated from the procedure start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRITRPD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected procedure interruption duration and the duration unit components and create PRITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The collected duration of the procedure interruption.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the interruption duration unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit for the duration of interruption of the procedure.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The unit should be collected as a qualifier to the number for duration.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRITRPD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected procedure interruption duration and the duration unit components and create PRITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit for the collected duration of the procedure interruption.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for coding. Another dictionary can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRLLT" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Lower Level Term". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRLLTCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Lower Level Term Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the lowest level term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR.QVAL dataset where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRPTCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL= "Preferred Term Code Lower Level Term Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVsin SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the preferred term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRHLT" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="High Level Term". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR.QVAL dataset where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRHLTCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="High Level Term Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRHLTGT" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="High Level Group Term". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the high level group term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: Procedure High Level Group Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM= "PRHLTGTCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="High Level Group Term Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the high level group term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR.QVAL dataset where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRSOC" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Primary System Organ Class". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: PR Primary System Organ Class Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM= "PRSOCCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Primary System Organ Class Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [name/type] of (the) substance used?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors may require different types of substance-use data (e.g., illicit drug use, cigarettes); the value for category may be pre-printed on the CRF as a label for the prompt for Substance Use. If a more detailed type of substance appears on the CRF (e.g., CIGARETTES, CIGARS rather than TOBACCO), SUCAT should be TOBACCO and SUTRT should be CIGARETTES.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of substance (e.g., TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, CAFFEINE or CIGARETTES, CIGARS, COFFEE).

Question.TranslatedText: What is/was the category of the substance (used)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Substance Used category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology (e.g., TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, CAFFEINE). Sponsors may require different types of substance-use data (e.g., illicit drug use, cigarettes); the value for category may be pre-printed on the CRF. If a more detailed type of substance appears on the CRF (e.g., CIGARETTES, CIGARS, rather than TOBACCO), SUCAT is TOBACCO and SUTRT is CIGARETTES. If the sponsor does not specify a type of tobacco on the CRF, SUTRT is TOBACCO. If SUCAT is not collected (e.g., it is evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the substance (used)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Substance Use subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The value for subcategory may be pre-printed on the CRF or hidden. SUSCAT can only be used if there is a SUCAT and it must be a subcategorization of SUCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the SUCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For pre-specified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified and free-text interventions, the value of SUPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is prespecified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any [sponsor-phrase/substance name/recreational drugs] used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject had used any (sponsor-defined phrase/recreational drugs/alcohol/substance name).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: General prompt question to aid in monitoring and data cleaning. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. This is a field that can be used on any Interventions CRF to indicate whether there is data to record.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether any data was collected for the intervention topic.

Question.TranslatedText: Has the subject ever [used/consumed] [SUTRT/SUCAT]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check the appropriate box to indicate if the subject has ever used/consumed tobacco/alcohol/caffeine, currently consumes tobacco/alcohol/caffeine, or formerly used/consumed tobacco/alcohol/caffeine.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The 3 options (NEVER, CURRENT, FORMER) are sponsor-defined in relation to the protocol. If the sponsor has specific definitions, these definitions are detailed in the instructions to the site. As this type of response does not correspond exactly to an SDTM variable, CDASH recommends using the CDASHIG variable SUNCF. Sponsors must decide how to populate the appropriate relative timing variables when creating the SDTM-based datasets. For example, If SUNCF ="Never", the value of SUOCCUR will be "N" and all relative timing variables will be null. If the sponsor chooses to populate the relative start references (SUSTRTPT, SUSTRF) the value will be "BEFORE" when SUNCF= "CURRENT" and "FORMER". If the sponsor also chooses to use relative end references (SUENRF, SUENRTPT) , the SUENRTPT value will be "ONGOING" when SUNCF="CURREN" while the value of SUENRF will be "DURING/AFTER". \n Note: When using SUSTRTPT and/or SUENRTPT, these must refer to a time-point anchor (e.g., SCREENING, in SUSTTPT/SUENTPT).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate SUOCCUR and relative timing variables.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the pre-specified substance was used.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the data was not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why the substance used data were not collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., subject refused) or entered as free text. When PRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What is/was the amount of [SUTRT] used/consumed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check the appropriate box to indicate the amount of tobacco/alcohol/caffeine the subject consumes on a regular basis.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Where possible, the options for dose/amount are pre-printed on the CRF. In the example given in the definition, "packs" and "ounces" are included as a point of reference. They would, of course, be submitted as SUDOSU. Care should be taken to map each record to the appropriate SDTM variable SUDOSTXT (text results that cannot be represented in a numeric field) and SUDOSE (numeric results).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to SUDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to SUDOSTXT in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The amount of substance used (e.g., 1-2 packs, 8 oz).

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the frequency of [SUTRT] [use/consumption]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record how often the subject regularly [uses / consumes] (the) [substance].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are pre-printed on the CRF. (e.g., PER DAY, PER WEEK, OCCASIONAL).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The number/amount of the of substance consumed per a specific interval.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the start date of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start date of the substance use using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month and year, year).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SUSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date substance use started, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the end date of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the end date of the substance use using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month and year, year).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SUENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date substance use ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the duration of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the duration of the substance use (e.g., Record how long the subject has smoked).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is only collected on the CRF if this level of detail is needed and if SUSTDAT and SUENDAT are not collected on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenating the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable SUDUR in ISO 8601 format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Collected duration of the substance use.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of duration of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the appropriate duration unit of the substance use.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined options should be pre-printed on the CRF to avoid making this a free-text field. This will allow the response to be translated into ISO 8601 format.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenating the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable SUDUR in ISO 8601 format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Unit of the collected duration of the substance use. Used only if duration was collected on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the substance use, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: If the value for SUTERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the substance use, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the generic drug name in published (e.g., WHODrug, SNOMED, ICD9) or sponsor-defined dictionaries. If SUPRESP is used, and the information about a specific standardized substance name is being solicited, the data from SUTRT may map directly to the SDTMIG SUDECOD variable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of SUTRT, or the modified topic variable (SUMODIFY), if applicable.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any adverse events experienced?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject experienced any adverse events. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether any AEs were experienced during the study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the adverse event category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the adverse event subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. AESCAT can only be used if there is an AECAT and it must be a subcategorization of AECAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the AECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications, procedures and/or medical history records with AEs. If CMAENO or PRAENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMAENO or PRAENO refers. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Description.TranslatedText: Reported Term for the Adverse Event

Question.TranslatedText: What is the adverse event term?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record only 1 diagnosis, sign, or symptom per line (e.g., nausea and vomiting should not be recorded in the same entry, but as 2 separate entries). Using accepted medical terminology, enter the diagnosis (if known); otherwise enter a sign or symptom.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Can be represented either as an open-entry field to capture verbatim terms reported by subjects or pre-printed, in the situation where solicited AEs of interest are captured. In most cases, the verbatim term (i.e., investigator-reported term) will be coded to a standard medical dictionary (e.g., MedDRA, WHO ART) after the data have been collected on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The reported or pre-specified name of the adverse event.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject have [pre-specified adverse event/group of adverse events]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if [specific adverse event] has occurred/is occurring, by checking Yes or No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH variable AEOCCUR is used to indicate the occurrence of pre-specified adverse events (e.g., "Did the subject have high blood pressure?"). AEOCCUR should not be used for spontaneously reported adverse events. The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Because the SDTM AE domain is intended to hold only adverse events that actually happen, all values collected in AEOCCUR for pre-specified AEs should be submitted in a Findings About Adverse Events data set (FAAE) where FAORRES=the value of AEOCCUR where FATESTCD="OCCUR". In addition, where AEOCCUR="Y", there should be a corresponding record in the AE domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a pre-specified adverse event or a group of adverse events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during SDTM-based dataset creation, when the AE is pre-specified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both pre-specified and free-text adverse events, the value of AEPRESP should be "Y" for all pre-specified events and null for events reported as free-text. AEPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific event or group of events are pre-specified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the adverse event start date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start date of the adverse event using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start date of the adverse event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the adverse event start time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start time (as complete as possible) of the adverse event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collecting the time an AE started is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event started and the study design is such that it is important to know the AE start time with respect to dosing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start time of the adverse event, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the anatomical location of the adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the anatomical location of the adverse event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the adverse event.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the side of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the adverse event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the directionality of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the adverse event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location of the adverse event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

Question.TranslatedText: Is the adverse event ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the adverse event has not resolved at the time of data collection; leave the End Date blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Completed to indicate that the AE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no end date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from AE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that End Date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as AEENRF or AEENRTPT. When populating AEENRF, if the value of AEONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating AEENRTPT, if the value of AEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When AEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable AEENRF should be populated. When AEONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables AEENRTPT and AEENTPT should be used. Note: AEENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in AEENTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication that an adverse event is ongoing when no end date is provided.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the adverse event end date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date that the adverse event. resolved using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the AE is ongoing, leave the field blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The definition of resolved is sponsor-specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date (if applicable). Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date when the adverse event resolved/ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the adverse event end time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the adverse event resolved.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collecting the time an AE resolved is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event resolved and the study design is such that it is important to know the AE end time with respect to dosing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time when the adverse event ended/resolved, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the severity of the adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: The reporting physician/healthcare professional will assess the severity of the event using the sponsor-defined categories. This assessment is subjective and the reporting physician/ healthcare professional should use medical judgment to compare the reported adverse event to similar type events observed in clinical practice. Severity is not equivalent to seriousness.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Either AESEV or AETOXGR must appear on the CRF. Some studies may mandate the collection of both. Refer to ICH E3 (Guideline for Industry Structure and Content of Clinical Study)/Section 12.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The severity or intensity of the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the [NCI CTCAE/Name of scale (toxicity) grade] of the adverse event?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: [NCI CTCAE/ Name of the scale] (Toxicity) Grade

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: The reporting physician/healthcare professional will assess the severity of the adverse event using the specified grades scale.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Either AESEV or AETOXGR must appear on the CRF. Some studies may mandate the collection of both. Refer to ICH E3 Section 12.2.4. CTCAE grade is commonly used in oncology studies, although it can also be used elsewhere. Other published toxicity-like scales can also be used.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target columnget. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The grade of the severity of the event using a standard "toxicity" scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the adverse event serious?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Assess if the adverse event should be classified as "serious," based on the criteria defined in the protocol.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is related to the individual SAE-type fields, which may or may not be collected on the CRF. Either AESER or all the SAE-type fields must be present on the CRF. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the adverse event is determined to be "serious," based on what is defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the adverse event result in death?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event resulted in death.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication the serious adverse event resulted in death.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the subject's date of death?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of death.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: In the CDASH model, Death Date is a timing variable; it is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains, as deemed appropriate by the sponsor (e.g., DS).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date of death for any subject who died.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the adverse event life threatening?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event is life threatening.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication the serious adverse event was life threatening.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the adverse event result in initial or prolonged hospitalization for the subject?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event resulted in an initial or prolonged hospitalization.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication the serious adverse event resulted in an initial or prolonged hospitalization.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the adverse event result in disability or permanent damage?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event resulted in a persistent or significant disability or incapacity.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication the serious adverse event was associated with a persistent or significant disability or incapacity.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the adverse event associated with a congenital anomaly or birth defect?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event was associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication the serious adverse event was associated with a congenital anomaly or birth defect.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the adverse event require intervention to prevent permanent impairment or damage resulting from the use of a medical product?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event required intervention to prevent permanent impairment or damage due to the use of a medical product.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Sponsors should see requirements for the reporting of adverse events involving medical devices. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication an adverse event required medical or surgical intervention to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or prevent permanent damage to a body structure, due to the use of a medical product.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the adverse event a medically important event not covered by other serious criteria?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event is an "important medical event," which may be defined in the protocol or in the investigator brochure.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication additional categories for seriousness apply.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the adverse event associated with the development of cancer?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event was associated with development of cancer.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data. "Involves cancer" (AESCAN) and "Occurred with overdose" (AESOD) are not part of the ICH definition of an SAE, but these categories are available for use in studies conducted under guidelines that existed prior to the FDA's adoption of the ICH definition.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication the serious event was associated with the development of cancer.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the adverse event occur with an overdose?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the serious adverse event occurred with an overdose.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If details regarding SAEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each SAE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field when collecting individual SAE types in a separate pharmacovigilance database. Sponsors should consult with regulatory agencies regarding the collection of this data. "Involves cancer" (AESCAN) and "Occurred with overdose" (AESOD) are not part of the ICH definition of an SAE, but these categories are available for use in studies conducted under guidelines that existed prior to the FDA's adoption of the ICH definition.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication the serious event occurred with an overdose.

Question.TranslatedText: Was this adverse event related to study treatment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the cause of the adverse event is related to the study treatment and cannot be reasonably explained by other factors (e.g., subject's clinical state, concomitant therapy, other interventions).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology is used to indicate the relationship between the AE and the study treatment (e.g., ICH E2B examples include "Not Related", "Unlikely Related", "Possibly Related", "Related"). Another possibility is the use of "Y" and "N". CDISC Controlled Terminology may be defined in the future. It is recommended that sponsors check with the appropriate regulatory authority for population of this variable to ensure it meets expectations for submission. There is no industry-wide controlled terminology for relationship to treatment. It is recommended that sponsors establish terminology and apply it consistently.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication the study treatment had a causal effect on the adverse event, as determined by the clinician/investigator.

Question.TranslatedText: What action was taken with study treatment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record changes made to the study treatment resulting from the adverse event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: CDISC Controlled Terminology is used to indicate the action taken with the study treatment in response to the AE. How to handle multiple actions taken is up to the sponsor. If this information is collected elsewhere (e.g., on the Exposure CRF), then it is not required to be collected on the AE CRF. This variable is not to be used for actions taken with devices. See the SDTMIG-MD for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the action taken with study treatment as a result of the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What action was taken with a device used in the study?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record actions taken resulting from the adverse event that are related to a study or non-study device.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology for actions that are related to the device (e.g., device removed, primary care physician notified). See the SDTMIG-MD for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly an SDTMIG variable. The sponsor may submit this data in a SUPPAE dataset where SUPPAE.QNAM = "AEACNDEV" and SUPPAE.QLABEL = "Actions Taken with Device". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the action taken, with respect to a device used in a study (which may or may not be the device under study), as a result of the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What other action was taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record all other action(s) taken resulting from the adverse event that are unrelated to study treatments given because of this AE.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is usually collected as a free-text field. If possible/desired, the sponsor can create controlled terminology (e.g., treatment unblinded, primary care physician notified).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of other action taken as a result of the event that is unrelated to dose adjustments of the study treatment.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the outcome of this adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the appropriate outcome of the event in relation to the subject's status.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: CDISC Controlled Terminology is used to indicate the outcome of the event as it relates to the subject's status. The Outcome controlled terminology includes ICH E2B values. The use of this field is the recommended way to describe whether and how the AE resolved. Because the outcome of an AE may be death, if this field is NOT used, be sure to provide another form, such as Disposition, with clear instructions to record deaths there.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the outcome of an event.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the adverse event cause the subject to be discontinued from the study?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if the adverse event caused the subject to discontinue from the study.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because the Action Taken field was defined to only collect changes made to the study treatment due to the AE, an additional field was created to identify the AE(s) that caused the subject to discontinue from the study. Some sponsors opt to capture this information only on the Subject Disposition CRF, whereas others choose to collect this data on both the Subject Disposition and AE CRFs, so the specific AE term(s) and related data can be identified. If the CRF is designed to link the DS and AE records, then RELREC can be used to identify that relationship.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly an SDTMIG variable. May be used to create a RELREC to link the AE to the Disposition record (see the SDTMIG). The sponsor may also submit this data in a SUPPAE dataset where SUPPAE.QNAM = "AEDIS" and SUPPAE.QLABEL = "Caused Study Discontinuation", if appropriate. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains..

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the event caused the subject to discontinue from the study.

Question.TranslatedText: Was this adverse event due to treatment other than study treatment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if this adverse event was due to treatment other than study treatment. If Yes, briefly describe this non-study treatment relationship.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the CDASH AERELNST field on the CRF was deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether, in the investigator's opinion, the event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the relationship to non-study treatment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be reported as free text (e.g., "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE"). If possible/desired, sponsors can create controlled terminology.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of the investigator's opinion as to whether the adverse event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.

Question.TranslatedText: Is this event of special interest?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the investigator's opinion as to whether the event is an adverse event of special interest by the sponsor.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH field may be used just to trigger other CRF pages, or populate a value in AECAT or AESCAT. If submitted, this information could be submitted in a SUPPAE dataset where SUPPAE.QNAM = "AESI" and SUPPAE.QLABEL = "Adverse Event of Special Interest. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An adverse event of special interest (serious or non-serious) is one of scientific and medical concern specific to the sponsor's product or program, for which ongoing monitoring and rapid communication by the investigator to the sponsor can be appropriate. Such an event might warrant further investigation in order to characterize and understand it. Depending on the nature of the event, rapid communication by the trial sponsor to other parties (e.g., regulators) might also be warranted.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the adverse event pattern?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: For each adverse event, check the pattern of the AE. If a single event, choose Single.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to report the pattern of the AE (e.g., "INTERMITTENT", "CONTINUOUS", "SINGLE EVENT"). For crossover trials, it is NOT recommended to capture this field for intermittent AEs. Instead, the AE should have corresponding start and stop dates to capture when the AE started and stopped.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time.

Question.TranslatedText: Was a concomitant or additional treatment given due to this adverse event?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Concomitant or Additional Treatment Given Due to This AE

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if any non-study treatments were received because of this adverse event. If Yes, medications should be recorded on the ConMed CRF and procedures recorded on the Procedures CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If medication data are reported, the CMAENO variable (on the CM CRF) may be used to collect the associated AE Identifier in order to populate RELREC. If procedures are reported, the PRAENO variable (on the PR CRF) may be used to collect the associated AE Identifier in order to populate RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether a concomitant or additional treatment given because of the occurrence of the event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: If the value for AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is typically not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT) in MedDRA.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary or standardized text description of AETERM or the modified topic variable (AEMODIFY), if applicable.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Will be the same as the AEBODSYS if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

Question.TranslatedText: Were any other actions taken in response to this adverse event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether any other action(s) were taken in response to the adverse event that are unrelated to study treatment dose changes or other non-study treatments given because of this event. If Yes, briefly describe these actions.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the AEACNOTH field on the CRF was deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether any other actions were taken in response to the adverse event that were unrelated to study treatment dose changes or other non-study treatments given because of this adverse event.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the clinical event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the clinical event category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the clinical event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the clinical event subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. CESCAT can only be used if there is an CECAT and it must be a subcategorization of CECAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the CECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any clinical events experienced?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject experienced any clinical events. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether any clinical events were experienced during the study.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications, procedures and/or medical history records with CEs. If CMCENO or PRCENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMCENO or PRCENO refers. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Description.TranslatedText: Reported Term for the Clinical Event

Question.TranslatedText: What is the clinical event term?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the clinical event or [insert text corresponding to the specific clinical event].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Can be represented either as a free-text field to capture verbatim terms reported by subjects; or pre-printed, in situation where solicited CEs of interest are captured. May be used as Specify Other field to collect more details on a pre-specified CEDECOD value, or when CEDECOD=Other. In most cases, the verbatim term (i.e., investigator-reported term) will be coded to a standard medical dictionary (e.g., MedDRA, WHO ART) after the data have been collected on the CRF

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The reported or pre-specified name of the clinical event.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject have [pre-specified clinical event/group of clinical events ]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if [specific clinical event] has occurred/is occurring by checking Yes or No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH variable CEOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of pre-specified clinical event not considered to be an adverse event by the sponsor. CEOCCUR should not be used for spontaneously reported events. The site should be able to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.
