mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a pre-specified clinical event or a group of clinical events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation when the clinical event is pre-specified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both pre-specified CEs and free-text events, the value of CEPRESP should be "Y" for all pre-specified events and null for events reported as free text. CEPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are pre-specified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [clinical event] start date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start date of the [clinical event ] using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start date of the clinical event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [clinical event] start time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If appropriate, record the start time (as complete as possible) of the [clinical event].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collecting the time a CE started is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event started and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE start time with respect to dosing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start time of the clinical event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the anatomical location of the clinical event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the clinical event.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the clinical event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the clinical event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the clinical event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the portion or totality of anatomical location of the clinical event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [clinical event] ongoing (as of [the study-specific timepoint or period]?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the clinical event has not resolved at the time of data collection. If ongoing, leave the end date blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Completed to indicate that the CE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no end date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from CE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that the end date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable (e.g., CEENRF, CEENRTPT). When populating CEENRF, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the values of "DURING", "AFTER", or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating CEENRTPT, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When CEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTMIG variable CEENRF should be populated. When CEONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables CEENRTPT and CEENTPT should be used. Note: CEENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in CEENTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the clinical event is ongoing when no end date is provided.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [clinical event] end date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date that the [clinical event] resolved using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the [clinical event] is ongoing, leave the field blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The definition of resolved is sponsor-specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date when the clinical event resolved/ ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [clinical event] end time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the [clinical event] resolved.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collecting the time an CE resolved is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event resolved and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE end time with respect to dosing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time when the clinical event ended/resolved, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the severity of the [clinical event]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: The reporting physician/healthcare professional will assess the severity of the event using the sponsor-defined categories. This assessment is subjective and the reporting physician/ healthcare professional should use medical judgment to compare the reported clinical event to similar type events observed in clinical practice.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Some studies may collect severity and/or toxicity grade.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The severity or intensity of the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the description of the toxicity?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the description of the toxicity.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This would typically be the text description quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of toxicity quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the toxicity grade?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the severity of the clinical event using the CTCAE toxicity grades.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Some studies may collect severity and/or toxicity grade. CDISC Controlled Terminology (TOXGRV3; TOXGRV4) may be used.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: If the value for CETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then CEMODIFY will contain the modified text.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is typically not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary- or sponsor-defined standardized text description of CETERM or the modified topic variable (CEMODIFY), if applicable.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term.

Description.TranslatedText: Clinical Event Lowest Level Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the lowest level term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the preferred term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: Clinical Event High Level Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: Clinical Event High Level Group Term

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the high level group term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: CE High Level Group Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the high level group term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Will be the same as the CEBODSYS if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: CE Primary System Organ Class Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Will be the same as CEBDSYCD if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the protocol deviation?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the deviation category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the protocol deviation?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the deviation event subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DVSCAT can only be used if there is an DVCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DVCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DVCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were there any protocol deviations?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Enter Yes if a protocol deviation occurred and No if none occurred. Ensure that any adverse event which triggers a protocol deviation (e.g., concomitant medication use, newly discovered medical history) is noted in the respective CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether there were any protocol deviations.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (standardized) protocol deviation (term/(code)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record protocol deviations identified and/or select the appropriate code from the list of protocol deviation terms.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: DVTERM and DVDECOD may have the same value. If the CRF is collecting protocol deviations using a codelist of responses, then DVDECOD should be used to store the codelist response. Sponsors must use either DVDECOD or DVTERM on the CRF and, in some cases, both may be used. For example, if the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free-text descriptions of codelist items, then DVTERM should be used to store the detailed descriptive text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The sponsor-defined standardized text for the name of the protocol deviation.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the protocol deviation term?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the appropriate code from the list of protocol deviation terms.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: DVTERM and DVDECOD may have the same value. If the CRF is collecting protocol deviations using a free-text field, then DVTERM should be used to store the free-text response. Sponsors may use either DVDECOD or DVTERM on the CRF, but a value in DVTERM is required in the SDTM-based datasets.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The reported or pre-specified name of the protocol deviation.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the protocol deviation start date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start date that the protocol deviation using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). This should be the start or occurrence of the protocol deviation, not the date it was discovered or reported.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be derived if not collected on a CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start date of deviation, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the protocol deviation start time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If appropriate, record the start time (as complete as possible) of the protocol deviation in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss). This should be the start or occurrence of the protocol deviation, not the time it was discovered or reported.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start time of the deviation, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the protocol deviation end date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the end date of the protocol deviation using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). This should be the date the protocol deviation stopped, not the date it was discovered or reported.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end date of the deviation, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the protocol deviation end time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If appropriate, record the end time (as complete as possible) of the protocol deviation in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss). This should be the time the protocol deviation stopped, not the time it was discovered or reported.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end time of the deviation, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: Were there any healthcare encounters?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject experienced any healthcare encounters. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether there were any healthcare encounters.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the healthcare encounter?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Examples include HOSPITALIZATION and OUTPATIENT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the healthcare encounter?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. HOSCAT can only be used if there is an HOCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of HOCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the HOCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject have [prespecified healthcare encounter term]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if [specific healthcare encounter/event topic] has occurred/is occurring by checking Yes or No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH variable HOOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a pre-specified healthcare encounter. HOOCCUR is not used if the healthcare encounters are collected on the CRF in a manner that requires a free-text response. The site should be able to indicate in a separate item (or system variable) that the question was not asked or answered.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a health encounter occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation, when the healthcare encounter is pre-specified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both pre-specified healthcare encounters as well as free-text events, the value of HOPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified events and null for events reported as free-text. HOPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are specified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the data were not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why the subject's Healthcare Encounters experience was not assessed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (e.g., subject not asked) or entered as free text. When HOREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable HOSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the healthcare encounter?; If [HODECOD], specify

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the healthcare encounter or if used with a HODECOD list, "Other" specify.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsors must use either HODECOD or HOTERM and in some cases, both may be used. If the CRF is collecting healthcare encounters using a standardized sponsor-defined code list (e.g., INPATIENT ER, ICU, SURGERY, GENERAL WARD, PROVIDER OFFICE - PRIVATE, PROVIDER OFFICE - HOSPITAL, GASTROENTEROLOGIST), then HODECOD may be used to store the code list response. If the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free-text descriptions of code list items, then HOTERM may be used to store the detailed descriptive text. If HOTERM is entered only as free text, HODECOD would be populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The reported or pre-specified name of the healthcare encounter.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (standardized) healthcare encounter (term/code)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the healthcare encounter.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsors must use either HODECOD or HOTERM and in some cases, both may be used. If the CRF is collecting healthcare encounters using a standardized sponsor defined code list (e.g., INPATIENT ER, ICU, SURGERY, GENERAL WARD, PROVIDER OFFICE-PRIVATE, PROVIDER OFFICE-HOSPITAL, GASTROENTEROLOGIST), then HODECOD may be used to store the code list response. If the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free-text descriptions of code list items, then HOTERM may be used to store the detailed descriptive text. If HOTERM is entered only as free text, HODECOD would be populated through the sponsor's coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The sponsor-defined standardized text description of HOTERM or the modified topic variable (HOMODIFY), if applicable.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] [start/admission] date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start date of the healthcare encounter (e.g., date of admission) using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The preferred method is to collect a complete start date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable HOSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start date the healthcare encounter, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] [start/admission] time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start time (as complete as possible ) of the healthcare encounter in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable HOSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start time of the healthcare encounter, (e.g., time of admission), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] [end/discharge] date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the end date of the healthcare encounter using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable HOENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end date of the healthcare encounter (e.g., date of discharge), represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] [end/discharge] time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the end time (as complete as possible) of the healthcare encounter in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable HOENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end time of the healthcare encounter (e.g., time of discharge), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the duration of the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the duration of the healthcare encounter.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected duration of the healthcare encounter. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from the start and end date/times.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenate the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable HODUR in ISO 8601 Period format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Collected duration of the healthcare encounter.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the duration unit of the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the appropriate duration unit of the healthcare encounter.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: To ensure data quality, it is recommended that the appropriate duration unit(s) be pre-printed on the (e)CRF. If only 1 unit is appropriate, no data entry would be required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenate the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable HODUR in ISO 8601 Period format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Unit of the collected duration of the healthcare encounter. Used only if duration was collected on the CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] ongoing(as of the[study-specific timepoint or period?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Ongoing as of the[study-specific timepoint or period]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the healthcare encounter as ongoing ('Y') if it has not stopped at[at the timepoint defined by the study].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Completed to indicate that the healthcare encounter has not ended at the time of data collection. It is expected that every reported encounter has either an end date or the Ongoing field is populated, but not both. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that End Date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox. See Section 3.7, Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and SDTMIG for more information.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable (e.g., HOENRF, HOENRTPT). When populating HOENRF, if the value of HOONGO is "Y", the values of "DURING", "AFTER", or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating HOENRTPT, if the value of HOONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When HOONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable HOENRF should be populated. When HOONGO is compared to any other time point, the SDTMIG variables HOENRTPT and HOENTPT should be used. \n Note: HOENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in HOENTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication that the encounter is ongoing when no end date is provided.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason for the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason for the subject's Healthcare Encounters.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: To ensure data quality, it is recommended that the sponsor develop controlled terminology (e.g., LACK OF EFFICACY, ADVERSE EVENT, CHEMOTHERAPY, PHYSICAL THERAPY, INDICATION UNDER STUDY, NOT INDICATION UNDER STUDY). The sponsor may, however choose to collect this as free text or as a combination of pre-printed options and free text in the form of "Specify, Other".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPHO dataset as the value of SUPPHO_QVAL where SUPPHO.QNAM ="HOREAS" and SUPPHO.QLABEL="Healthcare Encounter Reason". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Denotes the reason for the healthcare encounter.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s), which precipitated the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the adverse event that precipitated this encounter.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent is to establish a link between the healthcare encounter record and the AE that was the primary cause of the encounter. HOAENO can be used in RELREC to identify a relationship between records in HO dataset and records in the AE dataset. Other identifiers needed to create RELREC (e.g., HOMHNO) can be created as needed. See SDTMIG for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Adverse Events domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the adverse event that precipitated this encounter.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any medical conditions or events reported?; Has the subject had any medical conditions or events?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject experienced any medical conditions or events. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether there was any medical history to report.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the medical history?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology (e.g., CARDIAC, GENERAL). This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. This would be used when specific medical history (e.g., disease under study details) is captured, in addition to the general medical history.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the medical history?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Typically would be used when specific medical history (e.g., disease diagnosis) is captured, in addition to the general medical history. MHSCAT can only be used if there is an MHCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MHCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MHCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the medical history was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date on which the medical history was collected using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This should be a complete date. The date of collection may be determined from a collected visit date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date on which the medical history was collected, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications and/or procedure records with MH. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system. If CMMHNO or PRMHNO is used, this is the identifier to which CMMHNO or PRMHNO refers.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the medical history event date type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: The instructions depend upon the format of the CRF. Sponsors may print these values on the CRF or use them as defaulted or hidden text.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of start/ and or end date (e.g.,, DIAGNOSIS, SYMPTOMS, RELAPSE, INFECTION). It is not related to the trial's condition. This date type cannot be a PRIMARY DIAGNOSIS, SECONDARY DIAGNOSIS because these terms do not define the date type.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Specifies the aspect of the medical condition or event by which MHSTDTC and/or MHENDTC is defined.

Description.TranslatedText: Reported Term for the Medical History

Question.TranslatedText: What is the medical condition or event term?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record all relevant medical conditions or events, as defined in the protocol. Record only 1 medical condition or event per line. Ensure that the medical conditions or events listed on the Medical History page do not meet any of the exclusion criteria.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors should collect all relevant medical conditions or events, as defined in the protocol. It is a best practice for sponsors to collect all relevant history of surgeries or procedures using the associated diagnosis in the MH domain, while reporting relevant surgeries and procedures in the SDTM PR domain. Sponsors should provide instructions on how surgeries and procedures will be handled based on the protocol requirements. Information on specified surgeries or procedures should be collected in the PR domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The reported or pre-specified name of the medical condition or event.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject have [prespecified medical condition/event/group of medical conditions]; Is the [prespecified medical occurring]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if [specific medical condition/event] has occurred/is occurring by checking Yes or No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: MHOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of specified medical conditions or events. MHOCCUR is not used if the medical conditions or events are collected on the CRF in a manner that requires spontaneously free-text response. The site should be able to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a pre-specified medical condition/event or a group of medical conditions/events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation when the medical condition or event is prespecified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both pre-specified medical history and free-text events, the value of MHPRESP should be "Y" for all pre-specified events and null for medical conditions or events reported as free text. MHPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are pre-specified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the medical condition or event start prior to [MHSTTPT]?; Did the medical condition or event start prior to study start?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check if the medical condition or event started [before the study].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors may collect this information rather than start dates. See Section 3.7, Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.4.7 for more information.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as MHSTRF or MHSTRTPT. When populating MHSTRF, or MHSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field MHPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When MHPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable MHSTRF should be populated. When MHPRIOR is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables MHSTRTPT and MHSTTPT should be used. Note: MHSTRTPT must refer to the time-point anchor described in MHSTTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the event occurred prior to study start.

Question.TranslatedText: Is the medical condition or event ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the medical condition or event as ongoing ("Y") if it has not ended at the time of data collection. If the medical condition or event is ongoing, the end date should be left blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Completed to indicate that the condition has not resolved at the time of data collection. It is expected that every reported condition has either an end date or the Ongoing field is populated, but not both. See Section 3.7, Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.4.7 for more information.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as MHENRF or MHENRTPT. When populating MHENRF, if the value of MHONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating MHENRTPT, if the value of MHONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When MHONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable MHENRF should be populated. When MHONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables MHENRTPT and MHENTPT should be used. \n Note: MHENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in MHENTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the medical condition or event is ongoing when no end date is provided.

Description.TranslatedText: MH Disease or Symptom Under Control

Question.TranslatedText: Is the medical condition or event under control?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the most appropriate response.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: MHCTRL is not defined in the SDTMIG MH domain. If collected, it should be submitted in the SUPPMH dataset. If MHCTRL is collected, the sponsor must provide information on the relative timeframe. Generally, MHDAT is collected or determined using the visit date of the collection to indicate this is the subject's status at the time of data collection.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMH dataset as the value of SUPPMH.QVAL where SUPPMH.QNAM ="MHCTRL" and SUPPMH.LABEL="Medical Condition Under Control". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication of whether the medical condition or event is under control at the time of data collection.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [medical event or condition/category of the event] start date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start date of the medical event or condition using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month and year, year).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MHSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The start date of medical history event or condition, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What[is/was] the[medical event or condition/category of the event] end date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the end date of the medical event or condition using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month and year, year).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MHENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end date of medical history event or condition, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the anatomical location of the medical event or condition.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for skin rash). Could be a defaulted or hidden field on the CRF for prespecified [MHTERM/Event Topic]. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the medical condition or event.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the medical event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the medical event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event Location Portion or Totality

Question.TranslatedText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the of the medical condition or event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location of the medical event.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: If the value for MHTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then MHMODIFY will contain the modified text.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary text description of MHTERM or the modified topic variable (MH MODIFY), if applicable.

Description.TranslatedText: Medical History Event Lowest Level Term

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term.

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event Lowest Level Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the lowest level term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the preferred term.

Description.TranslatedText: Medical History Event High Level Term

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event High Level Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event High Level Group Term

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the high level group term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event High Level Group Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the high level group term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event Primary System Organ Class

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Will be the same as MHBODSYS if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived text description of the primary system organ class (SOC).

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event Primary System Organ Class Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding. Will be the same as MHBDSYCD if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary-derived code for the primary system organ class (SOC).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the disposition?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. In this implementation scenario, DSCAT="PROTOCOL MILESTONE" or "OTHER EVENT".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A categorization of the disposition events, which is used to distinguish between disposition events, protocol milestones, and other events.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the disposition?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DSSCAT can only be used if there is an DSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of the Protocol Milestone or Other Event.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the trial period for this disposition event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check the [epoch, or insert more appropriate wording] for which disposition event is being recorded.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If protocol milestones or other events are collected more than once in the study, EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as part of the title of the page; however, some companies have a standard CRF module that includes a pick-list of epochs. See the SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Trial Epoch (e.g., 'BLINDED TREATMENT', 'OPEN LABEL TREATMENT', 'SCREENING', 'RUN-IN') for which subject disposition is being collected.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Refer to the SDTMIG for guidelines for assigning DSCAT, DSTERM, and DSDECOD for events considered protocol milestones or other events. Where DSCAT = "PROTOCOL MILESTONE", DSTERM contains the verbatim (as collected) and/or standardized text; DSDECOD uses the extensible controlled terminology codelist (PROTMLST). Where DSCAT="OTHER EVENT", DSDECOD uses the extensible controlled terminology codelist (OTHEVENT).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. Both DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The standardized terminology of the disposition term.

Description.TranslatedText: Reported Term for the Disposition Event

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When defining protocol milestones or other events, sponsors may populate DSTERM and DSDECOD with the same value (e.g., RANDOMIZATION, INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED). DSTERM may also be populated with a verbatim term, which is then standardized in DSDECOD.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The verbatim or pre-specified name of the disposition term.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [protocol milestone/other event name] (start) date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of the protocol milestone/other event as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions, using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
