mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each protocol milestone/other event and its associated (start) date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the specified protocol milestone (e.g., informed consent, randomization) represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [protocol milestone/other event name] (start) time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time (as complete as possible) as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each protocol milestone/other event (start) time. Collecting the time of the event is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of the specified protocol milestone (e.g., informed consent, randomization) or other event, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: Was (study) treatment unblinded by the site?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record "Yes" if the subject's treatment assignment was unblinded/unmasked intentionally due to an adverse event, or unintentionally for other reasons (e.g., an administrative action) during the subject's blinded/masked treatment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If DSUNBLND is "Yes" and information was collected about the reason for the unblinding, populate DSCAT with "OTHER EVENT" and the SDTMIG variables DSTERM with the free text and DSDECOD with the standardized text (e.g., TREATMENT UNBLINDED). If DSUNBLND is "Yes", and the unblinding also resulted in the subject discontinuing the trial prematurely, be sure to capture the applicable discontinuation details. If the unblinding occurred due to an adverse event, DSTERM contains the text of the AE (if collected on the CRF) and in the AE domain the SDTMIG variable AEACNOTH ("Were any other actions taken in response to this adverse event?") may include the text "Treatment Unblinded". DSUNBLND may also be used to document intentional unblinding at a protocol-defined point in the trial.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. If the CDASH field DSUNBLIND="Y", then the SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM="TREATMENT UNBLINDED" and DSCAT ="OTHER EVENT". If DSUNBLIND="N", then the CRF should be annotated to indicate that this value is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the subject's treatment information was revealed to any unauthorized site personnel during the trial.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the disposition?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. This is used to distinguish a DISPOSITION EVENT, a PROTOCOL MILESTONE, or an OTHER EVENT. In this implementation scenario, DSCAT="DISPOSITION EVENT"

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A categorization of the disposition events which is used to distinguish between disposition events, protocol milestones, and other events.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the disposition?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DSSCAT can only be used if there is an DSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of the Disposition event.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the trial period for this disposition event?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check the [epoch, or insert more appropriate wording] for which disposition is being recorded.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If disposition events are collected more than once in the study, EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as part of the title of the page; however, some companies have a standard CRF module that includes a pick-list of epochs. See the SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Trial epoch (e.g., 'BLINDED TREATMENT', 'OPEN LABEL TREATMENT', 'SCREENING', 'RUN-IN') for which subject disposition is being collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subject's status (at the EPOCH/study specific time frame)?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Status (at the EPOCH/study specific time frame)

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Document the subject's status at [insert text corresponding to the selected trial epoch/study specific time frame]. If the subject discontinued prematurely, record the primary reason for discontinuation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: DSDECOD can be used as the standardized coded list with DSTERM used to capture any "Specify, Other" information, or DSDECOD can be used on its own. For sponsor- and/or study-specific reasons for discontinuation, it is recommended that these reasons be pre-printed on the CRF, as subcategories of the appropriate standardized DSDECOD item. However, it is recommended to limit the use of sponsor and study-specific reasons in order to promote consistent use of terminology and permit the combination of data across multiple sponsors. Either DSTERM or DSDECOD must be on the CRF. Both may be used if DSTERM is used as a Specify, Other field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. Both DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in the SDTM-based datasets. If DSTERM was collected as an "Other, Specify" free text, populate DSTERM with the free text and populate DSDECOD with the sponsor-defined standardized text. If DSDECOD was collected with no free text, populate DSTERM and DSDECOD in the SDTM-based dataset with the DSDECOD value that was collected.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The standardized terminology of the disposition term that describes whether a subject completed the study or a portion of a study (epoch), or the reason they did not complete.

Description.TranslatedText: Reported Term for the Disposition Event

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subject's status?; If [DSDECOD], specify

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Document the subject's status at [insert text corresponding to the selected trial epoch]. If the subject discontinued prematurely, record the primary reason for discontinuation. (Or, if used with a DECOD list) If Other is selected from the Status list, provide the verbatim reason.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If used with a DECOD list, free-text description of the subject's "Other" status. DSTERM is the verbatim term for subject status when Other is selected from the DSDECOD code list. This field would only be used with the prompt and completion instructions provided as a Specify, Other field in conjunction with DSDECOD. DSTERM may be used by itself when no code list is provided for DSDECOD on the CRF. Either DSTERM or DSDECOD must be on the CRF. DSTERM is required in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM. If DSTERM was collected as an "Other, Specify" free text, populate the SDTMIG variable DSTERM with the free text and populate DSDECOD with the sponsor-defined standardized text. If DSDECOD was collected with no free text, populate DSTERM and DSDECOD in the SDTM-based dataset with the DSDECOD value that was collected.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The verbatim or pre-specified name of the event. The reported or pre-specified name for how a subject completed the study or a portion of a study (epoch), or the reason they did not complete.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the disposition event date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of disposition event as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions using this format (DD-MON-YYYY)

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each epoch for which a Disposition CRF will be provided. Define also the date of completion or discontinuation. Only collect the date of the disposition event once. For example, if the date of the last dose is defined to mark the end of the treatment phase epoch, and is collected on the Exposure CRF, then this field would not be collected on the Disposition CRF. If not collected elsewhere, this field is collected on the Disposition CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the specified disposition event (e.g., study completion or discontinuation), represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the disposition event time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the subject completed the study or portion of the study as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions. If the subject did not complete the study or portion of the study, record the time (as complete as possible) as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each epoch for which a Disposition CRF will be provided. Define also the date of completion or discontinuation. Collecting the time of completion or discontinuation is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. Typically, it is not recommended that a time be collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time of the event. Only collect the time of completion or discontinuation on the Disposition CRF module if the same information is not being collected on another CRF module. For example, if the time of the last dose is defined to mark the end of the treatment phase epoch, and is collected on the Drug Exposure CRF, then this field would not be collected on the Disposition CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of the specified disposition event (e.g., study completion or discontinuation), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the subject's date of death?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of death

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but is populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may also be mapped to other SDTM domains (e.g., DS) as deemed appropriate by the sponsor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date of death for any subject who died.

Question.TranslatedText: Will the subject continue?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if the subject will be continuing to [the next phase of this study/related study] (sponsor to specify as appropriate).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors should specify the next phase of the study or the related study on the CRF. Typically this is a prompt to aid in monitoring and data cleaning, and usually not submitted in a SUPPDS dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPDS dataset as the value of SUPPDS.QVAL when SUPPDS.QNAM= "DSCONT" and SUPPDS.QLABEL="Subject Continue". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The plan for subject continuation to the next phase of the study or another study at the time of completion of the CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the next [epoch/period/study/trial] the subject will [continue to/enter/enroll]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned subsequent [study epoch/study] in which the subject intends to participate.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors should specify the next phase of the study or the related study on the CRF. The data are to be used to aid in monitoring and data cleaning. No specific SDTM-based dataset mapping rules are provided because the mapping depends on the situation (e.g., next epoch, next trial). Per sponsor decision, plans to enter the next epoch within a study may be included in the SDTM submission datasets (e.g., SE). Actual subject entry into the next study is submitted as part of Trial Design datasets of that study.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined SDTMIG mapping.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifies the study epoch or new study in which the subject will participate.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the finding about measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the FA CRF using the Findings About Date (FADAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable FADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Description.TranslatedText: Findings About Object of the Observation

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsored-defined phrase]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: [Protocol-specific]

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The FAOBJ will usually be pre-printed or hidden, not solicited as an actual question. These FA domains are usually created by the sponsor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by FATEST.

Question.TranslatedText: Has the subject had any [Findings topic(s)] (after/before [study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were] (there) any [Findings topic(s)] (reported) (after/before [study specific time frame])?; Were all eligibility criteria met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the there are findings. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is a field that can be used in any CRF to indicate whether there is data to record. Used primarily as a data cleaning field, it provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. FAPERF should be used to capture a response about whether planned measurements, tests, or observations were done.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether data was collected for the finding topic.

Question.TranslatedText: [Were any/Was the] [FATEST/topic] ([measurement(s)/test(s)/examination(s)/specimen(s)/sample(s))] [performed/collected]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [FATESTs] was/were collected. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is used to capture a response to whether a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the FASTAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable FASTAT. If the CDASH variable FAPERF="N", the value of the STDM variable FASTAT is "OT DONE". If FAPERF="Y", FASTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., FACAT and FASCAT, FATPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable FATESTCD would be populated with FAALL and an appropriate test name (FATEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, observation or specimen was performed or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the findings about assessment was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the FA measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the FA CRF using the Date of Collection (FADAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable FADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date when the findings about assessment was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the findings about assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the name (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the FATEST if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTM variable FATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in FATEST. The SDTMIG variables FATESTCD and FATEST are required in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name for the test being performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [measurement/test/examination] detail name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the detail of the [FATEST], if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: It is recommended that the test detail name be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test," "Test Name" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A further description of FATESTCD and FATEST.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [type/category/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the FA category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [type/subcategory/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the FA subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. FASCAT can only be used if there is an FACAT, and it must be a subcategorization of FACAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the FACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: In what position was the subject during the [measurement/ test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection]?; What was the position of the subject (during the [measurement/test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of the subject during the FA test.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.

Description.TranslatedText: FA Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [result/amount/(subject's) characteristic] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the FATEST result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the unit of measure associated with the test, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Description.TranslatedText: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the lower limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the FA test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: --ORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment, or could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in FAORRES.

Description.TranslatedText: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the FA test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: --ORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment, or could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in FAORRES.

Question.TranslatedText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record where the test results were categorized within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Reference ranges may be defined by FAORNRLO, FAORNRHI, FASTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [--TEST ] not [completed/answered/done/assessed/evaluated ]?; Indicate if the([--TEST] was) not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [FATEST] measurement was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH FAPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF", if populated from other sources such as a free text or sponsor-defined listing for FAREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [is/was] the reason that the [Findings topic/data/information/sponsor-defined phrase] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why an FA test was not collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the specimen type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the condition of the specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When local processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the anatomical location (of the [measurement/test/examination]) or What [is/was] the anatomical location where the [measurement/specimen] was taken/collected)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of the measurement.

Description.TranslatedText: Laterality of Location of Finding About

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the side (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the [FATEST] measurement.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations of the location of the FATEST. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e.,arrangement of, apportioning of).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method used for the measurement, test, or examination.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the lead (used to measure [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lead used for measurement.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lead or leads identified to capture the measurement for a test from an instrument.

Question.TranslatedText: [Is/Was] the subject fasting (prior to the [test being performed/sample being collected])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the (sponsor-defined phrase) information?; Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person providing the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the identifier of the [evaluator name/reporter name] (providing the-sponsor-defined phrase-information)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used in conjunction with FAEVAL to provide an additional level of detail.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in FAEVAL.

Question.TranslatedText: [Is/Was] the ([measurement/test/examination]) result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the [FATEST] result was clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPFA dataset as the value of SUPPFA.QVAL when SUPPFA.QNAM = "CLSIG" and SUPPFA.QLABEL = "Clinical Significance". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-pinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-pinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the visit is typically pre-pinted on the CRF, and should match the name of the visit in the protocol. May be used to derive the SDTM variable VISITNUM. \n Note: Sponsors may have CDASH visit-numbering or visit-naming conventions to handle special circumstances (e.g., unscheduled visits). In such cases, the appropriate visit numbers and visit names may need to be populated when creating SDTM submission datasets.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the skin response measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the skin response measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Skin Response CRF using the date (SRDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was a skin response test performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if a skin response test was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SRSTAT. If SRPERF="N", the value of SRSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If SRPERF="Y", SRSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SRCAT and SRSCAT, SRTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SRTESTCD would be populated as SRALL and an appropriate test name (SRTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned skin response measurement, series of skin response measurements, tests, or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the test was not done?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why the test or examination was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When SRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable SRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the skin response?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the skin response category, if not pre-pinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the skin response?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the skin response subcategory, if not pre-pinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. SRSCAT can only be used if there is an SRCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of SRCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the SRCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Description.TranslatedText: Skin Response Object of the Observation

Question.TranslatedText: What intervention was performed to elicit the skin response?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the antigen administered to the skin to elicit the skin response.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by SRTEST.

Description.TranslatedText: SR Date of Reference Time Point

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the [intervention] performed to elicit the skin response?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of the test material administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. If the date of administration is collected on a separate CRF (e.g., VISDAT), then it should not be collected on the SR CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the reference time point, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Description.TranslatedText: SR Time of Reference Time Point

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the [intervention] performed to elicit the skin response?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time of the test material administration using this format (hh:mm:ss).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis of the skin response (e.g., multiple [intervention] administrations.)

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of the reference time point, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed, if not pre-pinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for skin response). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of skin response test.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location where the test was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Description.TranslatedText: Skin Response Test or Examination Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the skin response test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the skin response test if not pre-pinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-pinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. SRTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in SRTEST. The SDTMIG variables SRTESTCD and SRTEST are required in SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: Skin Response Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point for skin response measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time-point labels for skin response, if not pre-pinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points be pre-pinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. Time-point anchors SRTPTREF (text description) and SRRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables SRTPTNUM, SRELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the skin response measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of the visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the measurements, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the skin response measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time of measurement (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The time of measurement (if required) can be determined from a collected time of the visit (VISTIM); in such cases. a separate measurement date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location where the test was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier of the evaluator providing the skin response information?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If EVALID needs to be collected for each test on the horizontal record the CDASH variable [SRTESTCD]_ EVALID can be used.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in SREVAL.

Description.TranslatedText: SR Results or Findings in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the skin response measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the skin response test result.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the skin response test as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the skin response measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the unit of measurement associated with the test, if not pre-pinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-pinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the categorization of the test results, within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The category of the value within the respective reference range. Ranges may be defined by SRORNRLO and SRORNRHI or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the skin response result was clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If this level of information is needed, it may be added to the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPSR dataset as the value of SUPPSR.QVAL where SUPPSR.QNAM ="SRCLSIG" and SUPPSR.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the skin response result was clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the drug accountability assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the DA CRF using the date (DADAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was drug accountability performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not drug accountability was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented on a CRF page level on a visit-by-visit basis. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF="N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". If DAPERF="Y", DASTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., DACAT and DASCAT, DATPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable DATESTCD would be populated as DAALL and an appropriate test name (DATEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned drug accountability assessment was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the type of treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type of treatment dispensed/returned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it can be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. See SDTMIG DA domain examples for populating DACAT and DASCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the study treatment dispensed/returned (e.g., Bottle A, Bottle B).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate grouping values, but different from those for DACAT). See SDTMIG DA domain examples for populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the drug accountability assessment was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the exact date the study treatment was (dispensed or returned), using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the study treatment was dispensed or returned, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the treatment label identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record treatment label identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to tie together a block of related records and to link dispensed product to returned product. The packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional identifier variables.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as treatment label identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the drug accountability being assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the drug accountability assessment if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column heading. For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable DATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in the CDASH field DATEST. The SDTMIG variables DATESTCD and DATEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding (e.g., dispensed, returned).

Description.TranslatedText: DA Assessment Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the result of the drug accountability assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the actual amount of treatment dispensed or returned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the drug accountability assessment as originally dispensed or returned (e.g., actual amount).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the death details assessments were reported can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Death Detail CRF using the date (DDDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a category value pre-printed on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header DDSCAT can only be used if there is an DDCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DDCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DDCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any death detail assessments collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the death details are known. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: General prompt to establish whether any death details are available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date death detail assessments were collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
