mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subject's date of death?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of death.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains (e.g., DS), as deemed appropriate by the sponsor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date of death for any subject who died.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the death detail assessment test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the death detail assessment, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable DDTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in DDTEST. Both DDTESTCD and DDTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name for death details.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail response.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the death detail assessment, as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the death detail assessment information?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using theis format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the inclusion and exclusion assessments were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Inclusion/Exclusion CRF using the date (IEDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable IEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were all eligibility criteria met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record Yes if all eligibility criteria were met at the time the subject was enrolled. Record No if subject did not meet all criteria at the time the subject was enrolled.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the subject met all the eligibility requirements for this study at the time the subject was enrolled.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the eligibility criteria assessment was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record complete date when the eligibility assessment was performed using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable IEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of collection of the inclusion/exclusion criteria represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the criterion?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check the appropriate box to indicate whether the criterion exception was related to the subject's inclusion or exclusion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: These categories have been defined in SDTM and have controlled terminology that must be used. Only records for criteria that are not met appear in the IE SDTMIG domain. IECAT must be populated. This criterion category may be collected on the CRF in a tick/checkbox format or it may be included as part of the criterion identification and mapped when the SDTM submission datasets are created.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping category to denote whether the protocol entry criterion being assessed is inclusion criteria or exclusion criteria.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the criterion?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. This can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or to categorize the criterion as a major or minor exception.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the IECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier of the inclusion criterion the subject did not meet or the exclusion criterion the subject met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If the subject was not eligible, record the identifying code for each criterion that was an exception.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is required to appear on the CRF, but may be null if there are no exceptions to the inclusion/exclusion criteria. The CRF should allow multiple exceptions to be recorded. See SDTMIG for assumptions regarding protocol versioning. Sponsors may provide a list of inclusion/exclusion criteria and the unique identifying codes to the site. The list provided should be versioned/updated when the protocol changes and the criteria are changed. Sponsors should use sponsor-developed controlled terminology for IETESTCD.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unique identifier associated with the criterion that was the exception.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the description of the inclusion criterion the subject did not meet or the exclusion criterion the subject met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the description of the criterion, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors could automatically populated the text in EDC systems when the criterion identifier is populated by the investigator. This can be verified by the PI to ensure the right exception identifier was selected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable IETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in IETEST. The SDTMIG variables IETESTCD and IETEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the inclusion or exclusion criterion that was the exception.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is only a data collection field when a complete list of inclusion and exclusion criteria are included on the CRF with Yes/No response options. If the sponsor collects only the criteria that are not fulfilled, then, when an inclusion criterion is not met, IEORRES is mapped to "N" and when an exclusion criterion is met, IEORRES is mapped to "Y".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of which inclusion criterion was not met or exclusion criterion was met.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the OE measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the OE CRF using the Ophthalmic Examinations (OEDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Which eye/eyes?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record which [eye was/eyes were] the focus of the finding or observation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is expected to be populated for ophthalmic studies. It is used as the key identifying variable to denote the focus (which eye or eyes) of the test finding or observation.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used for the identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen (as described in the protocol), for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1"), or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back"). The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.

Question.TranslatedText: Was an ophthalmic examination performed?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is used to capture a response regarding whether a planned measurement, test, or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the --STAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable OESTAT. If the CDASH variable OEPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable OESTAT is "NOT DONE". If OEPERF= "Y", OESTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., OECAT and OESCAT, OETPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable OETESTCD would be populated with OEALL and an appropriate test name (OETEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.3 Section 4.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the ophthalmic examination measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable OEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the ophthalmic examination measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time the ophthalmic examination measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of the measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Description.TranslatedText: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the ophthalmic [measurement/test/examination]?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The test name will usually be pre-printed on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included as the column heading. OETEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected. See CDASHIG metadata tables for domain-specific TEST codelist names (e.g. EGTEST, FATEST).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable OETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in OETEST. The SDTMIG variables OETESTCD and OETEST are required in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name for the test being performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [measurement/test/examination] detail name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: It is recommended that the test detail name be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A further description of OETESTCD and OETEST.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [type/category] of the ophthalmic examination?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata tables and in the SDTMIG. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading. Note: CDISC Controlled terminology (IECAT) is used for the IE domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [subtype/subcategory] of the ophthalmic examination?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. OESCAT can only be used if there is a OECAT. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. OESCAT can only be used if there is a OECAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the OECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Description.TranslatedText: Result of Finding in Original Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the ophthalmic examination test?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [result/amount] (of the [measurement/test/examination])?; [Is/Was] the result [normal/abnormal/absent/present/ sponsored defined response]?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH field OERES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable OEORRES and must be mapped, for example: OERES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included and "Specify Other" is collected. OERES is collected using Normal, Abnormal and a description of the abnormality is collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The mapping instructions depend on the implementation, for example: Where OERES Normal, Abnormal or other similar type classifications (e.g., Absent/Present) with a description of the abnormal result using the CDASH field OEDESC. For SDTM submission datasets, If the CDASH field OERES = "NORMAL", populate the SDTM variables OEORRES and OESTRESC with the value of the CDASH field OERES. If the CDASH field OERES is "ABNORMAL", populate the SDTM variable OEORRES with the CDASH field OEDESC. If the reported findings in OEDESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable OESTRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and OEMODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in OEDESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable OESTRESC is populated with the CDASH OEDESC field. The SDTM variable OENRIND may be populated with "NORMAL" or "ABNORMAL" if appropriate. Where OERES is used to collect standardized values (e.g., a codelist) on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field OERESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other". When using this field, the "OTHER" value recorded in the CDASH field OERES field is mapped to the SDTM variable OESTRESC and the value in the CDASH field OERESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable OEORRES. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: In a case where OERES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field OERESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field OERES is mapped to the SDTM variable OESTRESC and the value in the CDASH field OERESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable OEORRES. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A free-text result which provides further information about the original received or collected result.

Description.TranslatedText: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lower limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination]?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: OEORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable OESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in OEORRES.

Description.TranslatedText: Normal Range Upper Limit- Original Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: OEORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable OESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in OEORRES.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the normal reference range (for this [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be populated for normal ranges that are reported as character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Normal references ranges that are expressed as characters ("Negative to Trace") or ordinal (-1 to 1).

Question.TranslatedText: How do the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Reference ranges may be defined by OEORNRLO, OEORNRHI, OESTNRC, or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator (e.g., Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL, ABNORMAL) may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the the category for the reported values?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results (e.g., "POSITIVE", "NEGATIVE"). The variable OERESCAT is not meant to replace the use of OENRIND for cases where normal ranges are provided.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indicator of the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason that the [ophthalmic examination finding] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When OEREASND is used, OESTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the ophthalmic examination?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For the OE domain, this value is pre-populated as "EYE". It does not need to be pre-printed on the CRF or collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of the measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Further detailing the laterality of the location of the OETEST within a given eye. It should never be used to designate "Right Eye" versus "Left Eye". OEFOCID is used to denote which eye is the focus of the observation. This may be pre-printed or collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Further detailing the directionality of the location of the OETEST (e.g., ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL). This may be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Further detailing the portion or totality of the location of the OETEST. This may be pre-printed or collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the identifier of the evaluator?

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in OEEVAL.

Question.TranslatedText: Is this record considered to be the [accepted/final] evaluation?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used where more than 1 assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be pre-printed on the CRF (e.g., multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column .

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the RE measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RE CRF using the Respiratory Assessments (REDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was a respiratory assessment performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not a respiratory assessment was done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the -STAT variable in SDTM as " NOT DONE".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable RESTAT. If the CDASH variable REPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable RESTAT is "NOT DONE". If REPERF= "Y", RESTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., RECAT and RESCAT, RETPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable RETESTCD would be populated with REALL and an appropriate test name (RETEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the respiratory measurement was taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the RE measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RE CRF using the Date of Collection (REDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable REDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the respiratory measurement was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the respiratory system measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A single collection time (e.g., RETIM) may be collected for all the measurements when they are performed at the same time. The time of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [RETESTCD]_RETIM.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable REDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Description.TranslatedText: RE Assessment Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What is the planned time point for this respiratory assessment measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time-point labels for respiratory assessment, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTM time-point anchors RETPTREF (text description) and RERFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables RETPTNUM, REELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the respiratory test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the respiratory test, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The test name will usually be pre-printed on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included in the column heading. RETEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable RETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RETEST using the Controlled Terminology List RETESTCD. The SDTMIG variables RETESTCD and RETEST are required in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the respiratory test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the respiratory assessment category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. RESCAT can only be used if there is a RECAT. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the respiratory assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the respiratory assessment subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. RESCAT can only be used if there is a RECAT, and it must be a subcategorization of RECAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the RECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Description.TranslatedText: RE Test Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the respiratory test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result (normal/abnormal/absent/present/ [sponsored defined response])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the overall assessment for [RETEST].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH field RERES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable REORRES and must be transformed. For example, \n 1. RERES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included and "Specify Other" is collected. \n 2. REORES is collected using Normal, Abnormal and a description of the abnormality is collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The mapping instructions depend on the implementation; for example: \n 1. Where RERES is to used collect Normal, Abnormal or similar type classifications (e.g., Absent/Present) with a description of the abnormal result using the CDASH field REDESC. For SDTM submission datasets, If the CDASH field RERES = "NORMAL", populate the SDTM variables REORRES and RESTRESC with the value of the CDASH field RERES. If the CDASH field RERES is "ABNORMAL", populate the SDTM variable REORRES with the CDASH field REDESC. If the reported findings in REDESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable RESTRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and REMODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in REDESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable RESTRESC is populated with the CDASH REDESC field. The SDTM variable RENRIND may be populated with "NORMAL" or "ABNORMAL" if appropriate. \n 2. Where RERES is used to collect standardized values (e.g. a codelist) on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field RERESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other". When using this field, the "OTHER" value recorded in the CDASH field RERES field is mapped to the SDTM variable RESTRESC and the value in the CDASH field RERESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable REORRES. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the description of the (abnormality/observed finding/[Sponsor-defined])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record all abnormal findings for the respiratory test in the space provided.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: RERES and REDESC are used when a question is asked to collect the finding result, with a follow-up question for a description of the finding. See CDASH General finding Assumptions

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable REORRES. If RERES="Normal", populate REORRES with the value of RERES. If RERES="Abnormal", populate REORRES with the value of REDESC.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Text description of respiratory test findings.

Question.TranslatedText: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail].

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide more detail for the "Other" result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: In cases where RERES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field RERESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field RERES is mapped to the SDTM variable RESTRESC and the value in the CDASH field RERESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable REORRES.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A free-text result which provides further information about the original received or collected result.

Description.TranslatedText: RE Ref Range Lower Limit- Original Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lower limit of the reference range?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the respiratory test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: REORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable RESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in REORRES.

Description.TranslatedText: RE Ref Range Upper Limit- Original Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the upper limit of the reference range?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the respiratory test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: REORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable RESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in REORRES.

Question.TranslatedText: How do the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record where the test result fell with respect to the reference range.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Reference ranges may be defined by REORNRLO, REORNRHI, RESTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator (e.g., Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL, ABNORMAL) may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.

Question.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [RETEST] was not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the respiratory assessment or measurement was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH REPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF"; if populated from other sources such as free text or sponsor-defined listing for REREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".

Question.TranslatedText: Was the was the reason that the respiratory (assessment/[RETEST]) was not [collected / answered / done / assessed / evaluated]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason the measurement or test was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When REREASND is used, RESTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the position of the subject during the assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of subject at time of test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether conditions for respiratory test, as specified in the protocol, were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then a CDASH variable [RETESTCD]_REPOS may be created for each RETESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Location used for the measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the respiratory test or measurement.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the respiratory test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the respiratory test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method used for the respiratory test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the identifier of the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in REEVAL.

Question.TranslatedText: Was this record considered to be the accepted evaluation?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Use where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the repetition number of the measurement within the time point.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPRE dataset as the value of SUPPRE.QVAL where SUPPRE.QNAM = "REREPNUM" and SUPPRE.QLABEL= "Repetition Number within Time Point". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).

Question.TranslatedText: Was this result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether respiratory test results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation, as required by the protocol.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPRE dataset as the value of SUPPRE.QVAL when SUPPRE.QNAM = "CLSIG" and SUPPRE.QLABEL = "Clinical Significance". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the reproductive system findings were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the reproductive system findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RP CRF using the date (RPDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable RPDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the reproductive system?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reproductive system category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the reproductive system?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reproductive system subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. RPSCAT can only be used if there is an RPCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of RPCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the RPCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Was a reproductive system evaluation performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not a planned reproductive system evaluation was done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for a series of reproductive system evaluations, or a specific reproductive system test. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable RPSTAT. If the CDASH field RPPERF="N", the value of RPSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If RPPERF="Y", RPSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., RPCAT and RPSCAT, RPTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable RPTESTCD would be populated as RPALL and an appropriate test name (RPTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the reproductive system test was not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason the measurement or test was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: Were there any reproductive system findings?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the there are reproductive system findings. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: General prompt question regarding whether any reproductive system findings are available.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the reproductive finding name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the name of the reproductive system finding, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable RPTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RPTEST. The SDTMIG variables RPTESTCD and RPTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name for reproductive system finding.

Description.TranslatedText: RP Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result for the reproductive system question?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reproductive system finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the finding defined in reproductive system finding, as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the reproductive system question was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This should be a complete date. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable RPDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date on which the reproductive system result or finding was collected, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the date the tests were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (RSDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the visit date as RSDTC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM), concatenate the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populate the SDTMIG variable RSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Description.TranslatedText: Category for Response or Clin Class

Question.TranslatedText: What is the [category/ criteria] for the [disease response/clinical classification] or What is the [response/clinical classification] criteria?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response is typically a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading. There are separate codelists used for categorizing records about oncology response criteria (ONCRCAT) or other clinical classification (CRSCAT). Collect if multiple clinical classifications, or disease responses are active in a single study/database; otherwise, information should be distinguished somewhere on a form (e.g., table name, title, tab).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Description.TranslatedText: Subcategory for Response or Clin Class

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory for the [disease response/clinical classification]?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. RSSCAT can only be used if there is an RSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of RSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the RSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [(disease) response/clinical classification] assessment performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment was performed.
