mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A Not Done checkbox, which indicates the test was "NOT DONE". Typically, there would be 1 check box for each measurement. This field can be useful to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable RSSTAT. If RSPERF="N", the value of RSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If RSPERF="Y", RSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., RSCAT and RSSCAT, RSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable RSTESTCD would be populated as RSALL and an appropriate test name (RSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned disease response or clinical classification assessment was performed.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Reason Not Done

Question.TranslatedText: Why was the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment not performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If the response was not collected, indicate why.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason that data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., Not Imaged, Patient Refusal, Site Error) or entered as free text. When RSREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable RSSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Assessment Date

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the response or clinical classification was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RS CRF using the Date of Collection (RSDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable RSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the Response or Clin Class was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the role of the person performing the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate who performed the assessment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (assigned by a person or a group). RSEVAL is expected for oncology response criteria. It can be null when the investigator provides all the data in a study. It should contain no null values when data from 1 or more evaluator are used in a study.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Evaluator ID

Question.TranslatedText: What is the evaluator identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Identify the evaluator providing this evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When multiple assessors play the role identified in RSEVAL, values of RSEVALID will attribute a row of data to a particular assessor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Link ID

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [Disease Response or Clinical Classification ]Link ID Identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected, record the unique [Disease Response or Clinical Classification] Link ID.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used to provide a unique code in order to link records across related CRFs (e.g., RS and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating RSLNKID.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link the disease response assessment to the related record in another domain which was used to determine the response result.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Link Group

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [Disease Response or Clinical Classification] Link Group Identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected, record the unique [Disease Response or Clinical Classification] Link Group ID.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used to provide a unique code in order to link a group of records across related CRFs (e.g., RS and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating RSLNKGRP.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping identifier used to link the disease response assessment to a group of related record in another domain which was used to determine the response result.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Assessment Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification] test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the RS test, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable RSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RSTEST. The SDTMIG variables RSTESTCD and RSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the disease response or clinical classification used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Original Result

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the response classification.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the disease response or clinical classification as originally received, collected, or calculated.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification] unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the subject characteristics were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the subject characteristics at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the SC CRF using the date (SCDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the subject characteristics?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristics category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the subject characteristics?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristics subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. SCSCAT can only be used if there is an SCCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of SCCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the SCCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were subject characteristics collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if subject characteristics information was collected. If Yes, record the appropriate details.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SCSTAT. If SCPERF="N", the value of SCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If SCPERF="Y", SCSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SCCAT and SCSCAT, SCTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SCTESTCD would be populated as SCALL and an appropriate test name (SCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether any subject characteristics were collected.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the subject characteristics were collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date the subject characteristics were collected using the format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of collection can be determined from a collected date of the visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject characteristics name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the subject characteristics if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable SCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in SCTEST. The SDTMIG variables SCTESTCD and SCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the subject characteristic of interest.

Description.TranslatedText: SC Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject characteristic?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristic.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the subject characteristic as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the date the test was collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (TRDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the vist date as TRDTC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable TRDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [tumor/lesion] [link group] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has the appropriate identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because TRLNKGRP is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. This is typically used in oncology clincial trials. It is intended to group all the assessments at a evaluation time point represented in the TR domain with the associated response assessments represented in the RS domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link related records across domains.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the [tumor/lesion] results?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the tumor/lesion result category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the [tumor/lesion] results?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the tumor/lesion result subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. TRSCAT can only be used if there is a TRCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of TRCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A subgrouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [tumor/lesion] evaluation was not done.

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [tumor/lesion] evaluation was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A Not Done checkbox, which indicates the test was NOT DONE. Typically, there would be 1 check box for each result. This field can be useful to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site record the value as "Not Done".

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason that the [tumor/lesion] was not [evaluated/assessed]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason the result was not provided.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When TRREASND is used, TRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the information?; Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier of the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the procedure used for [tumor/lesion] assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when the method used to assess the tumor/lesion occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is the date of the scan/image/physical exam used to evaluate the tumor/lesion. It is not the date the MRI or scan was read. This is typically not the visit date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable TRDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the procedure used for tumor/lesion assessment, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [tumor/lesion] Identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected, record the unique identifier for this tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used to provide a unique code for each identified tumor in order to link records across related CRFs (TU and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating --LNKID. Typically, the lesion/tumor is assigned the --LNKID at baseline when the tumor/lesion is identified, and this --LNKID is used at other visits to collect assessments on this tumor or lesion. \n Note: This variable may be collected using 1 CDASH variable name (e.g., TULNKID) and populated into TRLNKID when creating submisson datasets.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment result.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [tumor/ lesion] (assessment) test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the tumor lesion assessment, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable TRTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in TRTEST. The SDTMIG variables TRTESTCD and TRTEST are required in SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: TR Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the result for the [tumor/lesion assessment]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the tumor/lesion assessment result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Result of the tumor/lesion assessment. Both quantitative and qualitative results may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. In addition to the SDTMIG variable TRORRES, create TRTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of TRTEST from TRTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the TRTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the tumor/lesion assessment.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the [result/measurement]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Usually, the unit of the test is pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the vendor providing the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: It is recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the date the test was collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (TUDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the visit date as TUDTC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM), then concatenate the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populate the SDTMIG variable TUDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the [tumor/lesion] identification?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the tumor identification category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory for the [tumor/lesion] identification?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the tumor identification subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. TUSCAT can only be used if there is a TUCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of TUCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the TUCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any [target/non-target/new/sponsor-defined) [tumors/lesions] identified?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether [tumors/lesions] were identified. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is intended to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing tumor/lesions evaluations are confirmed missing. The sponsor may decide to map "No" responses using the appropriate SDTMIG variables. Typically, this would use the SDTMIG variable TUOCCUR, with an appropriate TUTEST.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Not submitted.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether any tumors were identified.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the [examination/procedure] used for [tumor/lesion identification]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the scan/image/physical exam date used to identify the tumor/lesion using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is the date of the scan/image/physical exam used to identified the tumor/lesion. It is not the date the MRI or scan was read. This is typically not the visit date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable TUDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the [examination/procedure] used for tumor/lesion identification, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the information?; Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier of the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [tumor/lesion] (link) identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected, record the unique identifier for this tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used to provide a unique code for each identified tumor in order to link records across related CRFs (TU and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating --LNKID. Typically, the lesion/tumor is assigned the --LNKID at baseline when the tumor/lesion is identified, and the this --LNKID is used at other visits to collect assessments on this tumor/lesion.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment result.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the procedure used to identify this [tumor/lesion] ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the procedure [ID or Line Number] used to evaluate the tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Intent is to establish a link between the TU identified and the procedure undergone to identify this tumor/lesion. TUPRNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the TU dataset and records in the PR dataset. See SDTMIG for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the PR domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The identifier for the procedure used to identify the tumor.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used to [evaluate/identify] the [tumor/lesion]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method used to evaluate/identify the tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors may collect the method used to identify the tumor/lesions via a codelist which includes the most commonly known or generally recognized terms. The values will represent the method generically, not the product of the method (e.g., photograph). A sponsor may customize or restrict the list of values per response criteria or protocol needs. At a minimum, the primary method of identification should be entered and is expected to be consistent throughout the study; recording secondary methods is at the discretion of the sponsor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the procedure [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the internal or external identifier assigned to the procedure/method used to identify the tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable may be used to collect a reference/accession number associated with the method used to identify the tumor/lesion. Sponsors may use the CDASH variable TUPRNO as an identifier for a procedure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier, such as image ID number (e.g., CT scan, MRI, ultrasound identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [tumor/lesion] Identification test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the TU test, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable TUTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in TUTEST. The SDTMIG variables TUTESTCD and TUTEST are required in SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the [type/classification] of [tumor/lesion] as defined by the criteria being employed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the TU classification. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD], for example, TUMERGE, TUSPLIT, TUMIDENT or [TESTCD]_TUORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the TU test code. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the tumor identification (e.g., classification or type of tumor).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the [tumor/lesion] (identified)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location. A location detail text field (TULOCDTL) is conditional for entry (i.e., can be left blank) and allows the study site to specify the lesion in its own terms or can be used to distinguish tumors within the same location if other location qualifiers are not specific enough.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the laterality of the anatomical location?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the body within the anatomical location of the identified [tumor/lesion].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality within the anatomical location of the identified [tumor/lesion].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What [were/are] additional details on the exact location of the [tumor/lesion] so that it can be distinguished from other [tumor/lesion] in the same anatomical location?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Describe additional detail on the exact location of the tumor so that it can be distinguished from other tumors in the same anatomical location.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Use if TULOC and TULAT and/or TUDIR values cannot provide uniqueness from other identified tumors. TULOCDTL is not meant to replace TULOC, TULAT, and/or TUDIR or serve as the free-text description field for TULOC (e.g., Location, Other).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPTU dataset as the value of SUPPTU.QVAL where SUPPTU.QNAM="TULOCDTL" and SUPPTU.QLABEL= "TU Identification Location Detail".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A detailed description of the location of the identified tumor/lesion.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the vendor providing the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the VS measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the VS CRF using the Vital Signs Date (VSDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were vital signs performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if vital signs were collected. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable VSSTAT. If VSPERF="N", the value of VSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If VSPERF="Y", VSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., VSCAT and VSSCAT, VSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD would be populated as VSALL and an appropriate test name VSTEST provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned vital signs measurement, series of vital signs measurements, tests, or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the vital signs measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Description.TranslatedText: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time-point labels for vital signs, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time-point anchors VSTPTREF (text description) and VSRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables VSTPTNUM, VSELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the vital signs?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital signs category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be from a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the vital signs?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital signs subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. VSSCAT can only be used if there is a VSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of VSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the repetition number of the measurement within the time point.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be pre-printed on the CRF (e.g., multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPVS dataset as the value of SUPPVS.QVAL where SUPPVS.QNAM= "VSREPNUM" and SUPPVS.QLABEL= "Repetition Number within time point". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVsdard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the vital sign test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the vital sign test if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in VSTEST. Both VSTESTCD and VSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the vital sign measurement was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A Not Done checkbox, which indicates the test was NOT DONE. Typically, there would be 1 checkbox for each measurement. This field can be useful on individual VS tests to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".

Description.TranslatedText: VS Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital sign result.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This should be pre-printed on the CRF (or enterable from a picklist) with the associated test when possible, rather than collected as free-text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the vital sign result was clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPVS dataset as the value of SUPPVS.QVAL where SUPPVS.QNAM = "VSCLSIG" and SUPPVS.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the vital sign result was clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of vital signs measurements.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the position of the subject during the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of subject at time of test (e.g., SITTING).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether conditions for vital signs, as specified in the protocol, were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column..

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the drug accountability assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the DA CRF using the date (DADAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the test group identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on this horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie a block of related records in a single domain.

Question.TranslatedText: Was [DATEST] collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not drug accountability was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When mapped to SDTM, the value of DAPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DAPERF when implemented on a specific test basis. This is an example of the type of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF="N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". If DAPERF="Y", DASTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., DACAT and DASCAT, DATPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable DATESTCD would be populated as DAALL and an appropriate test name (DATEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned drug accountability assessment was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the type of treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type of study treatment for which drug accountability is assessed (e.g., STUDY MEDICATION, RESCUE MEDICATION, COMPARATOR, PLACEBO).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of study treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. The value of DACAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DACAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. This is an example of the type of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the study treatment dispensed (e.g., DRUG A, DRUG B, BOTTLE 1).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a category value pre-printed on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. If known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate grouping values, but different from those for DACAT). The value of DASCAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DASCAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the [DATEST] treatment label identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record dispensed treatment label identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional variables. This is an example of the type of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in EX domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as treatment label identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date [DATEST] drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date drug accountability was performed, using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed. A single date may be collected when all observations are performed on the same date. The date of each observation can also be collected using the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DADAT. The date of the observation may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required. This is an example the type of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the study treatment was dispensed or returned, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Description.TranslatedText: DA Assessment Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the amount of the [DATEST] drug accountability assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the result of the drug accountability assessment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] (e.g., RETAMT) or [TESTCD]_DAORRES, where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the DA test code (e.g., RETAMT_DAORRES). For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation and return. For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to link related records. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. In addition to the SDTMIG variable DAORRES, create DATESTCD from the CDASH variable name and derive the value of DATEST from DATESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain DATEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the drug accountability assessment (e.g., actual amount).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the [DATEST] result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The unit should be pre-printed on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
