Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY format).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the death details assessments were reported can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Death Detail CRF using the date (DDDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were any death detail assessments collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the death details are known. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: General prompt to establish whether any death details are available

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail category, if not pre-printed on the CRF

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a category value pre-printed on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a category value pre-printed on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header DDSCAT can only be used if there is an DDCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DDCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DDCAT values based on user defined characteristics

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date [DTHDX] assessment was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A single date may be collected for all death detail assessments when they are collected on the same date. The date of collection of each assessment can also be collected using a CDASH variable [DTHDXCD]_DDDAT. The date of the assessment may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subject's date of death?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of death.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains (e.g., DS), as deemed appropriate by the sponsor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date of death for any subject who died

Question.TranslatedText: What was the death detail assessment result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail response.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] (e.g., PRCDTH) or [TESTCD]_DDORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the DD test code e.g., PRCDTH_DDORRES. This variable name is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. In addition to the SDTMIG variable DDORRES, create DDTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of DDTEST from DDTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the DDTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the death detail assessment, as originally received or collected

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the death detail assessment information?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header EGSCAT can only be used if there is an EGCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of EGCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the EGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the ECG performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not an ECG or specific ECG test was done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF= "N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF = "Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned ECG measurement, series of ECG measurements, tests, or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: Which repetition of the ECG is this?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record which repetition of the ECG this is.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If there are multiple ECGs, this is used to record in which order this ECG occurred.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a timepoint, within a visit; multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (ECG) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer if this reference ID happens to be available to the site at the time of collection. It can also be used to link the clinical significance assessment to the proper record in the electronic data. (e.g., UUID for external waveform file, session number automatically generated by electronic equipment).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier of the ECG (e.g., waveform number).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method used for the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One possible condition is the method used to collect or calculate the ECG data. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Description.TranslatedText: ECG Lead Location Used for Measurement

Question.TranslatedText: Which lead location was used for this measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record which lead was used for this measurement.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is used when more specificity for the location is desired for the ECG data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lead used for the measurement (e.g., "LEAD I", "LEAD II", "LEAD III", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1")

Question.TranslatedText: What was the position of the subject during the ECG measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of the subject during the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the subject's position matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Position of the subject is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Position of the subject is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible position and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG with the subject in the wrong position.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during the ECG measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date the ECG was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the ECG was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the ECG measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time-point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time the ECG was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header EGSCAT can only be used if there is an EGCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of EGCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the EGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the ECG performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not ECG or specific ECG test was done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF="N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF="Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What repetition of the ECG is this?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record which repetition of the ECG this is.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If there are multiple ECGs, this is used to record in which order this ECG occurred.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a timepoint, within a visit; multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method used for the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One possible condition is the method used to collect or calculate the ECG data. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Description.TranslatedText: ECG Lead Location Used for Measurement

Question.TranslatedText: Which lead location was used for this measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record which lead was used for this measurement.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is used when more specificity for the location is desired for the ECG data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lead used for the measurement (e.g., "LEAD I", "LEAD II", "LEAD III", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1").

Question.TranslatedText: What was the position of the subject during the ECG measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of the subject during the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the subject's position matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Position of the subject is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Position of the subject is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible position and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG with the subject in the wrong position.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during the ECG measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date ECG was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the ECG was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the ECG measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time-point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time the ECG was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ECG test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the ECG measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in EGTEST. The SDTMIG variables EGTESTCD and EGTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: ECG Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record test results, interpretations or findings.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the ECG results?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be included if quantitative results are recorded. Because units for quantitative ECG results are typically limited, units should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than having sites record the units. This item is not necessary for qualitative results.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the ECG clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether ECG results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEG dataset as the value of SUPPEG.QVAL where SUPPEG.QNAM ="EGCLSIG" and SUPPEG.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the ECG results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding category, if not on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding subcategory, if not on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. EGSCAT can only be used if there is an EGCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of EGCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the EGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics

Question.TranslatedText: Was the ECG performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not an ECG or specific ECG test was done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF="N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF="Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed

Question.TranslatedText: Which repetition of the ECG is this?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record which repetition of the ECG this is.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If there are multiple ECGs, this is used to record in which order this ECG occurred.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a timepoint, within a visit; multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (ECG) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer if this reference ID happens to be available to the site at the time of collection. Examples: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) for external waveform file, session number automatically generated by electronic equipment. This can also be used to link.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier of the ECG (e.g., waveform number)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method used for the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination

Description.TranslatedText: ECG Lead Location Used for Measurement

Question.TranslatedText: Which lead location was used for this measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record which lead was used for this measurement.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is used when more specificity for the location is desired for the ECG data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lead used for the measurement (e.g., "LEAD I", "LEAD II", "LEAD III", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1")

Question.TranslatedText: What was the position of the subject during the ECG measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of the subject during the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the subject's position matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Position of the subject is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Position of the subject is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible position and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG with the subject in the wrong position.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during the ECG measurement

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date ECG was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the ECG was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the ECG measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time the ECG was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss)

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the information?; Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation

Question.TranslatedText: What was the interpretation of the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record overall interpretations of the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The overall interpretation of an ECG is mapped into the appropriate SDTM test and result variables. See the SDTMIG EG Domain for details.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, the recorded interpretation is populated into the SDTMIG variable EGORRES where EGTEST= "Interpretation", and EGTESTCD="INTP".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Overall interpretation of the result of the measurement or finding

Question.TranslatedText: Was the ECG clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether ECG results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation. In this scenario, clinical significance could be provided by the investigator.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEG dataset as the value of SUPPEG.QVAL where SUPPEG.QNAM = "EGCLSIG" and SUPPEG.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the ECG results were clinically significant

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Intent is to establish a link between the clinically significant ECG finding and the medical history event that was reported. EGMHNO can be used in RELREC to identify a relationship between records in EG dataset and records in the MH dataset. See the SDTMIG for information on creating RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the MH domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the adverse event that was the reported as a clinically significant ECG finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Intent is to establish a link between the clinically significant ECG finding and the AE that was reported. EGAENO can be used to identify a relationship between records in EG dataset and records in the AE dataset. See the SDTMIG for information on creating RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the AE domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the adverse event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the laboratory specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire lab panel, or a specific lab test. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF = "N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF = "Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, tests, observations or was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the lab specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) date when specimen collection was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category/subcategory (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology (e.g. electrolytes, liver function). This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point labels for the lab test, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time-point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM ="LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low-fat diet).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (laboratory test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of the laboratory specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire lab panel, or a specific lab test. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF="N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF="Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the lab specimen collection

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) date when the specimen collection was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology (e.g. electrolytes, liver function). This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time-point labels for the lab test, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time-point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol-defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM ="LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication of whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low-fat diet).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lab test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the lab measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in LBTEST. The SDTMIG variables LBTESTCD and LBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the lab test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Optional if already provided from central lab.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the lab result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Optional if already provided from central lab or a sponsor stores units separately.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was this result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether laboratory test results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Key data collected in this scenario.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM ="LBCLSIG" and SUPPLB.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (laboratory test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated.
