This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When local processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lab test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the lab measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in LBTEST. The SDTMIG variables LBTESTCD and LBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the lab test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the lab result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some lab tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., urine color).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the lab result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The collected, non-standard unit(s) should be reported as an equivalent standard unit in LBORRESU.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. The collected, non-standard unit(s) may be submitted in a supplemental qualifier dataset.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received if it were collected as a non-standard unit.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the toxicity grade?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the toxicity grade.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is commonly used in oncology trials but sponsors may not collect these toxicity grades on CRFs. Terminology codeslists (TOXGRV3, TOXGRV4) are available for use.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The toxicity grade, using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the description of the toxicity?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the description of the toxicity.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This would typically be the text description quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA)

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Ref Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lower limit of the reference range for this lab test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the lab test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI should be populated only for continuous results; LBSTNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be determined from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table. See the SDTMIG for details on mapping and selecting the proper variable name.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Ref Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the high limit of the reference range for this lab test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the lab test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI should be populated only for continuous results; LBSTNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be determined from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table. See the SDTMIG for details on mapping and selecting the proper variable name.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.

Question.TranslatedText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record where the lab result fell with respect to the reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Reference ranges may be defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI or other objective criteria. Typically for local processing, "Reference Range Indicator" may be derived or determined programmatically and is not collected on the CRF. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication or description of how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.

Question.TranslatedText: Was this result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether lab results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be included if required by the protocol.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM= "LBCLSIG" and SUPPLB.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the laboratory used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date that the microbiology specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microbiology findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the Microbiology Findings CRF using the date (MBDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation or specimen collection date can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was [specimen type] collected or [test topic] performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not the planned measurement, series of measurements, tests, or observations was performed or specimen was collected. \n

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MBSTAT is populated using the CDASH field MBPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MBREASND).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MBSTAT. If MBPERF = "N", the value of MBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MBPERF = "Y", MBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MBCAT and MBSCAT, MBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD would be populated as MBALL and an appropriate test name (MBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement or series of measurements, tests, or observations was performed, or specimen was collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microbiology test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] group identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions as to when it may be appropriate to group MB specimen records within a subject and how to indicate the specific MBGRPID.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject. Should not be used to link detection records in MB to the associated susceptibility results in the MS domain. NHOID should be used to identify the non-host organism.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG MBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microbiology finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microbiology finding category, if not pre-pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microbiology finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microbiology finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. MBSCAT can only be used if there is an MBCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MBCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of sample material taken from a biological entity.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using the format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date that the microbiology specimens were collected can be determined from from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microbiology findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the Microbiology Findings CRF using the date (MBDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation or specimen collection date can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the microbiology examination performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microbiology examination was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MBSTAT. If MBPERF="N", the value of MBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MBPERF="Y", MBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MBCAT and MBSCAT, MBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD would be populated as MBALL and an appropriate test name (MBTEST) provided. See the SDTMIG.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement or series of measurements, test, or observations was performed, or specimen was collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microbiology test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] group identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions as to where it may be appropriate to group MB specimen records within a subject and how to indicate a specific MBGRPID..

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject. Should not be used to link detection records in MB to the associated susceptibility results in the MS domain. NHOID should be used to identify the non-host organism.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] link identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology specimen or result record has a unique identifier that will link records across domains.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. May be used to link to susceptibility records (in MS) if needed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link related records across domains.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microbiology finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microbiology finding category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microbiology finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microbiology finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. MBSCAT can only be used if there is an MBCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MBCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the microbiology examination test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type or name of the microbiology examination, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MBTEST. Both MBTESTCD and MBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the microbiology test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the microbiology examination detail?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the detail of the microbiology examination, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Provides additional details for the microbiology examination. It is recommended that the test detail be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Detail of the microbiology examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: MB Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record test result, interpretation, or finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., where MBTEST="Microbial Organism Identification").

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMB dataset as the value of SUPPMB.QVAL where SUPPMB.QNAM = "MBCLSIG" and SUPPMB.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result category?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the category of the test results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., INFECTING, COLONIZER).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the result of a finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if the vendor name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Describes the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location, relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Description.TranslatedText: MB Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the microbiology specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microbiology susceptibility findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the MS CRF using the date (MSDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the Microbiology Susceptibility test performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not a microbiology susceptibility test was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MSSTAT is populated using the CDASH field MSPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MSREASND).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MSSTAT. If MSPERF="N", the value of MSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MSPERF="Y", MSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MSCAT and MSSCAT, MSTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MSTESTCD would be populated as MSALL and an appropriate test name (MSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, tests or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microbiology susceptibility test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier, such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required, The SDTMIG MSDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) time of susceptibility test (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microbiology susceptibility test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the microbiology susceptibility category, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microbiology susceptibility finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the microbiology susceptibility subcategory, or record if not pre-pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MSSCAT can only be used if there is an MSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the condition of the specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the non-host organism ID?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the non-host organism that is the subject of the test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism, which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the test

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The identifier for a non-host organism, which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the test.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the microbiology specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microbiology susceptibility findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the MS CRF using the date (MSDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the microbiology susceptibility test performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microbiology susceptibility test was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MSSTAT. If MSPERF = "N", the value of MSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MSPERF = "Y", MSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MSCAT and MSSCAT, MSTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MSTESTCD would be populated as MSALL and an appropriate test name (MSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, tests or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microbiology susceptibility test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier, such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] group identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology susceptibility test or result record has a unique identifier that will group records within a subject within the domain.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject. Should not be used to link detection records in MB to the associated susceptibility results in the MS domain. NHOID should be used to identify the non-host organism.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] link identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology susceptibility result has an identifier that will link records across domains.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be a one-to- one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, a single microbiology specimen or result may have multiple measurements/assessments performed (e.g., susceptibility testing).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link related records across domains.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection ,represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the the (microbiology) collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microbiology susceptibility finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the microscopic finding category, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microbiology susceptibility finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the microscopic finding subcategory, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MSSCAT can only be used if there is an MSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Description.TranslatedText: MS Organism Test or Finding Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the microbiology susceptibility test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type or name of the microbiology susceptibility test or examination, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable MSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MSTEST. Both MSTESTCD and MSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the microbiology susceptibility test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the microbiology susceptibility test detail?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the detail of the microbiology susceptibility test, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Provides additional details for the microbiology susceptibility test if necessary to define a unique record. It is recommended that the test detail be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Detail of the microbiology susceptibility test used to obtain the measurement or finding. Helps to establish a unque record.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the agent for which resistance is being tested?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the agent for which resistance is being tested.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the agent for which resistance is tested. The agent specified may be based on genetic markers or direct phenotypic drug sensitivity testing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of the agent for which resistance is tested.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the concentration of the agent?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the concentration of the agent.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Numeric concentration of agent listed in MSAGENT

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The concentration of the agent for which resistance is tested.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the agent concentration unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the concentration unit of the agent.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Units for value of the agent concentration listed in MSCONC

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The concentration unit of the agent for which resistance is tested.

Description.TranslatedText: MS Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record test result, interpretation, or finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the original unit in which these data were collected, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests, the units may not be applicable (e.g., where MSTEST requires simply a qualitative result).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMS dataset as the value of SUPPMS.QVAL where SUPPMS.QNAM="MSCLSIG" and SUPPMS.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result category?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the category of the test results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., "SUSCEPTIBLE", "RESISTANT")

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the result of a finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab name was not collected at the site/study level, or if multiple labs are used by a site

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the condition of the specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Describes the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Description.TranslatedText: MS Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than one method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person providing the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated.
