This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the microscopic findings specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microscopic findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the MI CRF using the date (MIDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation,or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the microscopic examination performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microscopic examination performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MISTAT is populated using the CDASH field MIPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MIREASND).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MISTAT. If MIPERF="N", the value of MISTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MIPERF="Y", MISTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MICAT and MISCAT, MITPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MITESTCD would be populated as MIALL and an appropriate test name (MITEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned microbiology measurement, series of microbiology measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microscopic test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier, such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microscopic finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microscopic finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MISCAT can only be used if there is an MICAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MICAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MICAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the condition of the specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Describes the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the microscopic findings specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microscopic findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the MI CRF using the date (MIDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the microscopic examination performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microscopic examination was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MISTAT. If MIPERF="N", the value of MISTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MIPERF="Y", MISTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MICAT and MISCAT, MITPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MITESTCD would be populated as MIALL and an appropriate test name (MITEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned microbiology measurement, series of microbiology measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microscopic test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier, such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microscopic finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microscopic finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MISCAT can only be used if there is an MICAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MICAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MICAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the name (of the microscopic [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type or name of the microscopic examination, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable MITESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MITEST. Both MITESTCD and MITEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the microscopic test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [microscopic measurement/test/examination] detail name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the detail of the microscopic examination, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Provides additional details for the microscopic examination. It is recommended that the test detail be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Detail of the microscopic examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: MI Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the test result, interpretation, or finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the original unit in which these data were collected, or record if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests, the units may not be applicable (e.g., reaction score for HER2).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMI dataset as the value of SUPPMI.QVAL where SUPPMI.QNAM="MICLSIG" and SUPPMI.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result category?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the category of the test results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., MALIGNANT or BENIGN, RESISTANCE VARIANT for genetic variation)

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the result of a finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the condition of the specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Describes the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Description.TranslatedText: MI Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person providing the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the PK samples were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the PK samples at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the PK CRF using the date (PCDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were PK samples collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check "No" if none of the samples were collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented at form level or sample level. These may be all samples of a particular type or all samples taken for some purpose and may need to be identified by the organization of the data on the form. Each sample collected could result in 1 or more tests performed, so there can be a one-to-one or one-to-many relationship between samples and tests/results.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT. If PCPERF="N", the value of PCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If PCPERF="Y", PCSTAT should be null. PCTEST and PCTESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., PCCAT and PCSCAT, PCTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD would be populated as PCALL and an appropriate test name (PCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether PK samples were collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Record "Not Done" if the PK sample was not collected.

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the specimen was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A Not Done checkbox, which indicates the test was "NOT DONE". Typically, there would be 1 checkbox for each measurement. This field can be useful on individual sample collections to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: This variable used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site record the value as "Not Done".

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the PK sample was not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why a PK sample was not collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when PK sample collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If left blank, "PCDATFL" for this specimen must be populated (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT); if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of PK sample collection or the start date of PK sample collection over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the specimen/sample collected on the same date as the [last/previous specimen/sample] [collected/collection ended]?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Same as Previous (Specimen/Sample Collection End) Date

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select when the date of this specimen collection is the same as the date of the previous specimen collected. If left blank, "PCDAT" for this specimen must be populated. (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected)

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When a series of specimens are collected on a single form, this field is tied to the collection date to allow for the flag to be used as a surrogate for the date field. Its selection means that the date of this specimen is the same as the date of the last specimen collected (in the series). This variable may be used when collecting PK data and re-entering dates is more cumbersome than selecting the checkbox.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Flag indicating that the PK date (or start date) is the same as the previous specimen collection date (or start date).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete time is expected. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time, when a specimen is collected at a point in time, or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of PK sample collection or start time for a specimen collected over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Description.TranslatedText: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time-point labels for the PK sample collection, if not pre-printed on the CRF. Note: Planned time points are often described as relative to the dosing of the study drug.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time-point anchors PCTPTREF (text description) and PCRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables PCTPTNUM, PCELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. Some study treatments may have a food effect, and it is important to know whether the dose was taken after the subject had fasted.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol-defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). This may not be relevant for all tests. Examples of conditions imposed may include calorie fast, fluid fast, high-fat meal, low-fat meal, and exercise.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPC dataset as the value of SUPPPC.QVAL where SUPPPC.QNAM ="PCCOND" and SUPP.PCLABEL= "Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication of whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low-fat diet).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (PK) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the specimen (material) type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a PK sample.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors typically collect tests related to the specimen characteristics on the CRF (e.g., Volume, Ph). Results for tests on an analyte (e.g., Concentration) would typically be populated when creating SDTM-based datasets. If the analyte test results are collected on the CRF, the test would be the analyte name. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PCTEST. The SDTMIG variables PCTESTCD and PCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the analyte or specimen characteristics used to obtain the PK measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: PK Sampling Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the test result, interpretation, or finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the original unit in which these data were collected, or record if not pre-printed on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the PK samples were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the PK samples at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the PK CRF using the date (PCDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started)

Question.TranslatedText: Were PK samples collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether all of the PK samples in this group were collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented at form level or sample level. These may be all samples of a particular type, or all samples taken for some purpose, and may need to be identified by the organization of the data on the form. Each sample collected could result in 1 or more tests performed, so there can be a one-to-one or one-to-many relationship between samples and tests/results.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT. If PCPERF="N", the value of PCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If PCPERF="Y", PCSTAT should be null. PCTEST and PCTESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., PCCAT and PCSCAT, PCTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD would be populated as PCALL and an appropriate test name (PCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether PK samples were collected

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the PK sample was not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why a PK sample was not collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation for why the data are not available

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when PK sample collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If left blank, "PCDATFL" for this specimen must be populated (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format..

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of PK sample collection or the start date of PK sample collection over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the start time of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record start time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete time is expected. In interval collection, start can be added as needed to the question text, prompt and CRF directions. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format..

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of PK sample collection or start time for a specimen collected over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the end date of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when PK sample collection stopped using this format (DD-MON-YYYY)

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The end date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end date of the specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the specimen collection end time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record end time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete end time is expected. The SDTMIG variable PCENDTC variable contains the end date/time, when a specimen is collected over time. If there is no end date/time, the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC should be Null.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end time of the specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss)

Description.TranslatedText: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time-point labels for the PK sample collection, if not pre-printed on the CRF. Note: Planned time points are often described as relative to the dosing of the study drug.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time-point anchors PCTPTREF (text description) and PCRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables PCTPTNUM, PCELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. Some study treatments may have a food effect, and it is important to know whether the dose was taken after the subject had fasted.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol-defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). Examples: calorie fast, fluid fast, high-fat meal, low-fat meal, exercise. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPC dataset as the value of SUPPPC.QVAL where SUPPPC.QNAM ="PCCOND" and SUPP.PCLABEL= "Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication of whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low fat diet)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (PK) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier)

Question.TranslatedText: What was the specimen (material) type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a PK sample

Question.TranslatedText: What was the test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors typically collect tests related to the specimen characteristics on the CRF (e.g., Volume, pH). Results for tests on an analyte (e.g., Concentration) would typically be populated when the SDTM-based datasets are created. If analyte test results are collected on the CRF, the test would be the analyte name. It is recommended that test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PCTEST. The SDTMIG variables PCTESTCD and PCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the analyte or specimen characteristics used to obtain the PK measurement or finding

Description.TranslatedText: PK Sampling Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the PK sampling test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the PK sampling test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of the physical examination can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the physical examination findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included collected on the PE CRF using the date (PEDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the physical examination performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If the physical examination was performed as planned, select Yes; otherwise, select No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. Used to ask if the physical exam was performed at the overall subject level at the specified time point. If this field is used, the result should only be mapped to PESTAT if the overall examination (at the subject level) was not performed. If the overall examination was performed, then the value of PESTAT would be null for each examined body systems and "NOT DONE" for any body systems not examined (see PERES).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PESTAT. If PEPERF="N" the value of PESTAT="NOT DONE". If PEPERF="Y", then the actual physical exam results would be reported by body system (see PERES). PECAT, PESCAT, PETEST and PETESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. If used for an entire CRF or other set of multiple tests with PECAT and PESCAT, PETESTCD=PEALL.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether a planned physical examination was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the physical examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the physical examination category, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The CRF can capture different types of physical exams using PECAT (e.g., GENERAL, OPHTHAMOLOGIC, NEUROLOGICAL). This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PECAT is not collected (e.g., it is evident from the protocol design), it could be populated when creating SDTM-based datasets.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was subcategory of the physical examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the physical examination subcategory, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The CRF can capture the different subtypes of PE categories using PESCAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PESCAT is not collected (e.g. it is evident from the protocol design), it could be populated when creating SDTM-based datasets. PESCAT can only be used if there is a PECAT, and it must be a subcategorization of PECAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the PECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the physical examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record complete date of examination using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of examination may be determined from the date of the visit (VISDAT); if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date when the physical examination was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the physical examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time of examination (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of examination, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the body system examined?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Per protocol, perform physical examinations of specified body systems.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors should preprint all body systems to be examined on the CRF. The use of a complete list of body systems eliminates the need for an Other, Specify category; any abnormalities identified would fall under 1 of the specified categories. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Body System" can be included in the column heading.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable PETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PETEST.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Name of the body system.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the results normal, abnormal, or not done?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the overall assessment for each exam category/body system listed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the examined body system is normal, then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up-front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable, then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC. When creating SDTM-based datasets, PESTRESC is the standardized value for PEORRES and is populated for any record where PEORRES is not null. If the abnormal findings are coded using a dictionary, then PESTRESC should be the dictionary preferred term; if not coded, PEORRES.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES="Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES="Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Overall assessment of examined body system.

Question.TranslatedText: If the result was abnormal, what were the findings?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record all abnormal findings for the given body system in the space provided.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the examined body system is normal, then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up-front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable, then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES="Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES="Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Text description of any abnormal findings.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the physical examination result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Was the physical examination result clinically significant? Select Yes or No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If this level of information is needed for reconciliation with adverse events, this field may be added to the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPE dataset as the value of SUPPPE.QVAL where SUPPPE.QNAM ="PECLSIG" and SUPPPE.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether the physical examination abnormality is clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the reason that data were not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason the assessment was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Captures the reason why the measurement or test was not done. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What is/was the [body system/ organ system]?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: PEBODSYS should be assigned using a coding system. If included on the CRF, it is prepopulated and must be paired by the sponsor with specific verbatim terms. If not included on the CRF, PEBODSYS is assigned through the coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Body system or organ class that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. PEMODIFY contains any modified text used for coding. Used only when the reported abnormalities in PEORRES are coded to a dictionary. This is in contrast to Events and Interventions domains, where the topic variable (TERM or TRT) is modified for coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: If the value for PEORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of physical examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the of the body system examined or the finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the proportionality of the anatomical location of the of the abnormal finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

Description.TranslatedText: PE Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?
